122123213113131121131.content:
You were relieved when Joe decided to find the exit rather than seek revenge. "Which way, do you think, bro?" Softly, you asked.

"The exit can not be far." Frowning, Joe replied. "I'm more worried about the transformed boy and her sister who are still trapped in that crazy maze."

"What do you plan to do?" Wincing, you asked.

Joe paused to listen. "We follow the voices."

You strained your ears to listen and was surprised to hear three women and three males arguing about flaws and protocol. "I can hear them now." Frowning, you said. "The dampening field must not work in this part of the house."

"I was hoping for that." Relieved, Joe said. "Now we might have some leverage to get one of them to show us the door."

You followed Joe through a number of newly constructed halls to a door where arguing could still be heard. "They must be so busy arguing with each other they didn't her us approach." Hopeful, you said. "We have the element of surprise."

Joe moved to touch the door handle then paused. "This isn't right." Whispering, he said. "This was way too easy for us."

"You sense a trap." Worried, you said.

Joe nodded then listened again, more intently. "There's static in with the voices." Irritated, he said. "It's being played through a speaker; we've been baited." He huffed, his anger returning. "Well. I'm not biting."

Joe continued down the hall, listening as he went as you followed, trying to determine what he was listening for. Finally, you heard the sounds of birds and Joe kicked a door, revealing the outside for the first time in hours! It was just before dawn; there was only a hint of light forming over the horizon. Unknown to you or Joe, the two of you had made it out just under the wire.

"I never thought the sun could look so good." Smiling, you said. "Only I wonder where we are."

Joe looked about and frowned. "It's the old silo we pass by every day going to school." Gruffly, he announced. "I had heard rumors that someone had converted it into a house." He scoffed. "Only what now? Did we pass this test or what?"

You looked at Joe and sighed. "I don't know if you passed or not but it does seem as if you had made a choice through your actions."

"What do you mean?" Grumpy, Joe demanded.

You produced a mirror for Joe to see himself. "It looks like you have chosen to be..."
122123213113131121131.title: Reason over rage.

1221232131131311211313.content:
Joe was once again himself only you sensed he was very different on the inside. "It doesn't matter which throne I take, laws will be changed." Angry, he said. "My destiny is not theirs to decide!"

Although you knew that was not the purpose of the Gauntlet, you also knew that trying to explain it to a distraught or furious witch boy was pointless. With a heavy sigh, you led Joe away from the silo to the main road where you were both surprised to find aunt Abra Mage waiting for you. "I had no part in this, kids." Serious, she said. "I am only to drive you both home."

Joe did not speak, he just stepped into the car with you following. The ride home was quiet and uncomfortable with no one daring to start any kind of conversation. It was not until we reached home when we found mom and dad waiting for us in the sitting room. "I have brought them home." Sternly, Abra said. "Beyond that, I will have no part of this. You know the rules of the Gauntlet, no further tests will be tolerated without council approval."

With that, she left and you turned to find Joe staring down his parents. "Why...?!" Furious, he demanded. "Why did you two send us through that house of horrors?!"

"We deemed it necessary to force a choice." Serious, dad replied. "There are four powers at play here and you could go either way, tipping the balance in anyone's favor."

"The Gauntlet is not ordered on a whim, Joe." Serious, mom added. "We had to prove to the witch council and the chaotic collective that the test was necessary."

"My destiny is not yours or anyone else's to decide for me!" Hysterical, Joe screamed.

"The gauntlet does not choose anyone's destiny, Joe." Calmly, a feminine voice said. We turned to see a girl no older than twelve approaching us. "It's purpose is to test which power is the strongest within you."

The strange girl who had entered the conversation was petite with long blond hair, blue eyes and doll like features wearing a simple white dress and flats. "What did you insane test reveal?" Still angry, Joe demanded.

"It revealed that your powers are equal across the board." simply, the girl replied. "I am Raven Falcon, your test councilor."

"When a cruel test is ordered upon a witch or mad scientist, a councilor is required to be present afterwords to help the one tested through the aftermath." Softly, you explained. "She's here to help you."

Joe grunted. "I'm not in the mood to talk." Darkly, he said. "I'm more in the mood to hit the gym so to calm my anger."

Raven nodded. "That is a good start." Smiling, she said. "You know what is needed to calm the storm within you and have an urge to do so rather than to simply lash out in anger."

Joe sighed. "I'm going to the gym." annoyed, he said. "Don't wait up."

"There is a full equip gym waiting for you in the basement." To your surprise, Raven said. "We can both work out together as we talk over your post test issues."

Joe turned to Raven surprised then gave a short laugh. "No offense but you hardly look like one who can keep up with my regiment."

Raven smiled kindly. "I may surprise you." Teasing, she said.

Joe shook his head. "Alright... councilor." Softly, he said. "Let's work out."

Raven turned to you. "You must join us as you are required a councilor as well."

"Working out is really not my cup of tea." Wincing, you said.

"Please try." Calmly, Raven said. "This is for both your benefits."

Reluctantly, you followed Joe and Raven to the basement where you did find a fully equip gym. Before Raven closed the door to the basement, she turned to mom and dad. "I suggest you two seek council as well. such cruel tests have been known to create a rift within a family."
1221232131131311211313.title: Aftermath.

12212321311313112113132.content:
The workout lasted nearly three hours. You came out with Joe, soaked with sweat, sore and tired. Raven did not seem to have even broken a sweat yet. "You did well for your first workout, sis." Kindly, Joe said. "It's a good way to curb aggression."

"I have a feeling I am going to be sore in the morning." Wincing, you said.

"Take a hot shower before bed." Calmly, Joe said. "That will help." He then turned to Raven. "I know you used magic in your work out..."

"I admit that is defeating the purpose of a work out." Calmly, Raven replied. "However, I must be at my absolute best and strongest through the entire counseling process in case something, anything goes wrong."

Joe snorted. "I'm calmer now but that does not justify what my sister and I were put through or what Cire and his, or rather, her sister went through."

"The two you mentioned are being counseled as well." Softly, Raven said. "Only my job is to focus on the two of you." She paused. "Your first concern is the justification..."

"What right do they have to force a choice I was just given only hours before when Gina was given time to decide... when Ina and Tia will likely have a choice!?" Angry again, Joe demanded. "What makes me so different when any of them could have been made a boy and a mad scientist as easily as I could become a witch?!"

Raven nodded. "I see... your concern is the lack of time to make such a life changing decision before being subjected to the gauntlet." She took a breath. "To understand that, you need to know of the five powers at play."

"Five powers...?" Raising an eyebrow, Joe asked.

"Witches have the power of magic which is cosmic in origin." Serious, Raven explained. "Only girls can use this power. However, witch born boys have magic too only it is physical in nature... this is why you are the strongest boy in the state."

"Those who become too strong are called Ironclads." Softly, you said. "Their magic power takes root but they are too physically powerful to shatter the forces keeping them male."

Raven nodded. "This gives them inhuman attributes and makes them insanely magic resistant." Calmly, she said. "They have the ability to throw spells back and shake the ground with a single stomp... a witch's worst nightmare."

"Then there are mad scientists." Serious, you said. "They have the power of chaotic energy which is why they are also called chaotic scientists."

"The power of a mad scientist is elemental but it comes from every Earth like planet in the known universe." Calmly, Raven said. "Only boys have this power but chaotic born girls have power over the elements which, in effect, gives them the same powers as witch born boys."

"Those girls who become too strong are called Amazons." Keeping a soft tone, you said. "They have the same powers as witch boys only it is elementally based rather than magic based."

"Okay... that's four powers..." Wincing, Joe said.

"The fifth power is the normals." Serious, Raven said. "They may not have magic or chaotic science but they are highly adaptable and have a power of their own."

"What power is that?" Surprised, you asked.

Raven was silent for a moment. "The general science of a normal is nothing a witch or mad scientist to take lightly." Darkly, she replied. "That and they out number us millions to one. Should this town alone turn against us, we would not stand a chance in hell... that is why we maintain the notion that the four powers do not exist."
12212321311313112113132.title: After the work out.

choices: either of you could take either throne.
Joe is destined to be king.
122123213113131121131321.content:
"How does all of this tie in to the nightmare Gina and I had to go through?" Frowning, Joe demanded. "Give it to me straight."

"It's political." Serious, Raven said. "Your father is the king of all mad scientists and your mother is next in line for the throne to the witching world."

"I'm guessing dad wants me to succeed him." Softly, Joe said.

Raven nodded. "Yes only there are witches who would rather see you willingly become a witch and that complicates matters for you."

"Why?" confused, Joe asked. "What would it matter if I become the next king?"

"You are more like your father than you or he are willing to admit." Softly, you said.

Raven shook her head. "It's because Joe is of both witch and chaotic blood." Darkly, she explained. "Imagine a mad science king who is also an Ironclad, or worse, a juggernaut."

You turned pale at that. "His power would be off the charts..." Whispering, you said.

"Your mother has the same fears regarding you, Gina." Serious, Raven said. "You have the potential of becoming a Mystic Amazon. This is a chaotic scientist's worst nightmare hence you never touched the weights before your training at Cauldron Academy last year."

You and Joe exchanged startled looks. A Mystic witch was the most powerful level any witch could achieve. A Mystic Amazon was a step higher... high level magic and juggernaut strength to match. You could only guess it was because you were of both witch and chaotic blood... like your grandmother, Ella Mist.

Seeing our reactions, Raven slowly nodded her head. "You now see what is at stake and why the gauntlet was necessary." Softly, she said. "Both of you have the potential of becoming extremely powerful and in leadership roles." She then whispered, "There are many on both sides in panic mode over this."

"So what did the gauntlet prove?" Gulping, you asked.

Raven sighed. "It proved that..."
122123213113131121131321.title: counseling continues.

13.content:
"He is in his room, probably sulking." Looking guilty, mom replied. "I introduced him to magic by turning him into his female equivalent for a few hours."

"Have you changed him back yet?" Curious, you asked.

Mom nodded, looking as if she were mad at herself.. "I did only I learned that Joe had been approached by students with strange offers to attend schools he never heard of; shoving brochures in his face, asking him to read them." She sighed, shaking her head. "He was already in a foul mood when he got home today..."

"The recruiters from both witches and mad scientists are starting on him early." Worried, you said. "I wonder why..."

"It has to do with your father rarely being around." Serious, mom explained. "You see, he is the new head mad scientist in this world. That and I am the daughter of the head witch."

This shocked and alarmed you. "Wait! What?!"

"It was the only way to ensure a peace treaty between the two powers." Gently, mom said. "He and I genuinely love each other; making it easier to form the pact of peace." She sighed. "The point is many witches would rather see Joe to become a girl and a witch to further slow down the growing population of mad scientists. Him being the next in line for the 'throne' complicates things greatly."

"So its political." Frowning, you said. "I feel a headache coming on."

"If Joe becomes a witch, it will be a blow to the mad scientists as they would have to choose a new king later down the road." Serious, mom said. "If he becomes a mad scientist, relations between the two powers will become complicated as I am the next in line to be the head witch."

You sighed, irritated. You knew there was at least one witch recruiter who had been watching Joe since before you left for Cauldron Academy. Her name was Lydia Rune; the student body principal of your school. She was tall and slender with shoulder length brown hair and blue eyes. She had a reputation of misleading people without breaking any rules of conduct. Then there was the mad science recruiter whom had approached you last year. His name was Josh Gary; average height with crew cut black hair and brown eyes. He was always professionally dressed, making him stand out like a soar thumb. You wondered if you should pay either one a visit.

Finally, you decided to...
13.title: A bad day all around.

131.content:
You decided it best to talk to Joe first before doing anything. His bedroom was on the first floor where mom's, yours, and the twins slept upstairs. At first hated having his bedroom away from everyone else. Only now, he enjoyed not having to fight for the bathroom with his sisters as he had his own bathroom suite and more privacy. You sighed reaching his door and knocked.

"Joe?" Concerned, you called. "Joe, I'm home. Can we talk?"

After a pause, you heard the click of the lock and saw the door open slightly. Taking it as a yes, you entered Joe's room to see him going over a number of brochures with a scowl on his face. "Can you believe that Lydia Rune wants me to change genders and sign up for this Cauldron Academy all girls boarding school?" Irritated, he asked. "I thought it was a joke until mom changed me into a girl and spoke of that same school!" He huffed, adding, "Worse, that stuck up Josh Gary wants me to sign up for that Eliete Scientiam all boys boarding school!"

"I graduated from Cauldron Academy." Softly, you said. "It's a great school for witches."

"I am an athlete." Firmly, Joe said. "Everyone in school knows my goal is to enter the Olympics gymnastics team."

"I know, Joe." Calmly, you said. "Still, magic is within you and if, if mind you, fate decides you are to become a girl, Cauldron Academy will teach you how reach your full magical potential."

"You sound as if you want me to go to that school." Pouting, Joe grumbled.

"I would rather you didn't go to Elite Scientiam." Honestly, you said. "Did mom explain it to you at all?"

Joe ruefully shook his head. "I didn't exactly stick around long enough to hear her out." Frowning, he admitted. "She hurt my feelings, my pride! She changed my body without my permission, making me feel completely weird!"

You nodded. "The first experience is always the worst." Calmly, you said. "I was changed into a boy for a week during my training to get a taste of what it feels like."

"They kept you a boy for a week?!" Alarmed, Joe asked. He frowned, showing a look of brotherly protectiveness. "Who did it..."

You giggled. "I appreciate you wanting to protect my honor, little brother." Bemused, you said. "However, it was necessary so I would understand how you would feel should I feel tempted to use my magic to pull a prank on you."

"Then why did mom change me?" Annoyed, you demanded. "Certainly she knows how it feels."

"For you to even detect magic, it has to be used against you at least once." Smiling, you explained. "For you to become resistant to magical power, it has to be used against you for a period of time, depending upon the boys will to fight off the magic."

"You mean like building a resistance to injury from punches in boxing?" Curious, you asked.

"Exactly." Nodding, you said. "Its not personal." You paused then asked, "Would you like me to explain what this is all about?"

Joe sighed before nodding. "Let's have it."

You explained dad's position and who mom will eventually become and what would happen if Joe were to go either way as a witch or mad scientist. Joe became increasingly pale as he listened to you and looked as if he were going to be sick when you finished. "If what you are telling me is true, I'm in the middle of a tug of war between mom and dad." Quivering, he said. "Mom wanting me to be a witch and dad wanting me to be a mad scientist."

"That's the just of it." Wincing, you said.

"Don't I get a say in this?!" Worried, Joe demanded.

"The choice is yours to make, bro." Honestly, you replied. "Still, that does not stop witches and mad scientists alike from trying to sway that decision."

"Including you and mom." Frowning, you said.

You sighed. "I admit, I would rather you be a witch than a mad scientist." Serious, you said. "Still, I am not trying to sway you, just give you the facts."

Joe sat down, rubbing one arm as he did when he was nervous or uncertain.
131.title: talk to Joe first.

choices: take a tour of Cauldron Academy.
take a tour of Elite Scientiam.
offer you a tour of his favorite gym.
1311.content:
After a minute or two, Joe sighed. "Since you graduated from this Cauldron Academy, you can tell me what its really like." Looking at you, he said. "I want the facts, sis; not a sales pitch."

You smiled, relieved that Joe was at least curious and happy that he was trying to be cautious. "Cauldron Academy is much like any other all girls boarding school with classrooms, sports activities, field trips, and so on." Calmly, you explained. "However, their main goal is to teach young girls of witch families the use and laws of magic."

"What of this Elite Scientiam school?" Curious, Joe demanded.

"It's basically the same only for boys born into families with chaotic blood like dad." With a slight frown, you replied. "They teach the use of mad or chaotic science, depending upon which term you are more comfortable with. This power has only been in this world for about two hundred years and their numbers are steadily growing."

"You say that as if its a bad thing." Uncomfortable, Joe said.

"We all have our own opinions." Flatly, you said. "I love dad to pieces, don't get me wrong. It's just that I've seen mad science in action. It's... cold and frightening." You shivered at the memory of seeing mad science being used at Cauldron Academy. What mad scientists could do with their minds and machines was terrifying to you."

Joe sighed. "Maybe... you were just shown the worst of what this mad science can do." Uncertain, he said. "It's possible the students at Elite Scientiam are shown the worst magic can do as a type of warning."

"Maybe..." Reluctantly, you agreed. "I could offer you a tour of Cauldron Academy so you can see for yourself some of what goes on there."

"Will I have to be a girl to do it?" Wincing, Joe asked.

You giggled. "No but you will have to wear a special bracelet that marks you as a visitor." Bemused, you said. Sighing, you added. "You could, of course, request a tour of Elite Scientiam if you want; its up to you."

Joe thought for a moment then decided to...
1311.title: Joe is curious but cautious.

choices: Young witches took notice of Joe.
13111.content:
"How soon can we take a tour of this Cauldron Academy?" Sighing, Joe asked.

You smiled, pleased that Joe was willing to at least consider witch school. "We can leave just as soon as we tell mom where we are going." Smiling, you said. "She will be pleased to hear you are interested in witch school."

"I'm curious, sis." Serious, Joe countered. "This school will really need to show me the wow factor to peek my interest."

You giggled. The 'wow factor' as Joe called it was elements that matched his likes and interests as well as his goals. "Let's tell mom then."

Mom, of course, was elated to hear Joe wanted to visit Cauldron Academy first and offered to make him his favorite meal of Lasagna upon their return. "Have fun, dear." Sweetly, mom said. "I wish to hear all about your visit when you get back."

You muttered the spell needed to take Joe and yourself to Cauldron Academy and braced yourself for the sudden shift of location. Only you forgot to warn Joe and he stumbled slightly as if he were suddenly dizzy. "That was weird." Panting, he muttered. "Warn me next time..."

"Sorry, bro." Bemused, you said. "Teleportation takes some getting used to. We're here."

It took Joe a moment to be able to look around. He and you were at the front gates of what looked like a normal private school campus. The entire property was surrounded by a tall stone wall with heavy iron gates that guard entrances on four sides. You and Joe were standing at the North gate where they welcomed visitors. A short thin woman in a guard uniform smiled at you upon seeing you and Joe appear. "Hello again, Gina." Kindly, she said. "What brings you back here so soon?"

"Hello again, Ms Harp." Kindly, you replied. "My brother Joe had recently received brochures from this school." You then frowned and softly added, "As well as one other."

Ms Harp nodded, pushing back her long black hair and Placed her green eyes onto Joe with a friendly smile. "We are pleased that you have chosen to visit our school first, young man." Remaining kind, she said. "Our school is far older and carries a long history of excellence." She then giggled and added, "Though you will be required to wear the visitor's bracelet at all times during your visit."

You giggled slightly, trying to hide your blush. "I nearly forgot..." You summoned a very curious bracelet embroidered with tiny images of flowers, ballerinas, high heels, and other feminine symbols and forced it onto Joe's left wrist. "Don't take that off until we are back home."

"What's this supposed to do other than embarrass me?" Blushing, Joe demanded.

"It's a magical device that protects you from the spells and enchantments that in turn protect those who come here to learn magic." Firmly but kindly, Ms Harp explained. "If you take it off before the end of your visit, you will become a girl, a witch, and a student at this academy for the full school year." She then smiled."Fell free to remove the bracelet at any time you feel this school is for you."

"Ms Harp!..." Gasping, you scolded.

Ms Harp shrugged, giving an innocent smile. "You can't blame a girl for trying."

You could only shake your head at that as the gates were opened and you lead Joe towards the visitor's building to sign him in for a tour. On the way there, you noticed that Joe was looking everywhere, taking in the sights. "One thing at a time, bro." Smiling, you said. "We need to sign in first before we can go wandering around."
13111.title: A tour of Cauldron Academy.

choices: Miss Dust is given the honor.
131113.content:
As you lead Joe to the nearest building, which was administrations, you became aware that your presence was drawing a small crowd of new students. Joe noticed this as well and was becoming visibly nervous. You took Joe's hand and silently urged him to walk faster. While he followed with a quicker pace, you could hear some of the comments the new students were making behind you.

"That's Joe Mage, the heir to the throne of mad scientists!" Whispering, one student remarked. "What is he doing here at Cauldron Academy?!"

"That must be his sister, Gina Mage." Also whispering, another student said. "I heard she was last year's top student, breaking all records."

A third student giggled. "She must have talked him into considering this school." Bemused, she whispered. "We may get another student before classes begin."

"Say nothing, Joe." Carefully whispering, you warned.

Albeit reluctantly, Joe remained silent despite comments from the young witch students they passed and followed you into the administrations building where you found the head witch, Ella Mist talking with the head of administrations. Ella Mist, your grandmother, was a tall, slender woman with long black hair and fiery hazel eyes. She wore a flattering black dress and high heels that seemed to make no noise when she walked. The head of administrations, Miss Dust was a short, slightly plump woman with shoulder length brown hair and green eyes. She wore a suit dress that flattered her figure. The two stopped talking upon seeing you enter. Miss Dust seemed surprised where Ella merely smiled kindly.

"Good afternoon, Gina, Joe." Smiling, Ella said. "This is a pleasant surprise."

"The recruiters started on Joe early." Wincing, you explained. You then smiled, adding, "He had questions the brochures could not answer and decided to visit here first."

"A very wise choice, if I may say so." Grinning, Miss Dust said. "Our school, although only for girls, offers an education and benefits that will greatly outweigh anything you may lose through a change in gender."

"With all due respect, I am here for a tour, Miss Dust." Firmly but kindly, Joe said. "I am looking for the facts, not a sales pitch."

"I am pleased to see that you are as cautious but not as blunt as your father." Smiling, Ella said. "I do believe a tour can be easily arranged."

"I would be honored to personally lead your tour." Offering, Miss Dust said.

"You offer is appreciated." Calmly, Ella said. "However, I believe it is in everyone's best interest if I conduct the tour myself."

"I respectfully request the honor, madam head witch." Bowing slightly, Miss dust said. "I vow not to fail you of this school..."

"Um... what's going on?" Confused, Joe asked in a whisper.

You held back a giggle. "They're arguing over who is going to give you the tour." Bemused, you whispered back. "It's not often the 'prince' of all mad scientists requests a tour of witch school."

"So its political..." Rolling his eyes, Joe whispered. "Great..."

You smiled, having thinking the same thing less than an hour before and watched as Ella and Miss Dust politely argued who would give you the tour..."
131113.title: Young witches took notice of Joe.

1311133.content:
"With all due respect, Miss Dust and madam head witch, the honor should be mine." Serious, you stated. "I alone gave the offer to my brother and he accepted. For someone else to give the tour, it would give the appearance of carrying an ulterior motive."

Ella turned to you, surprised but then smiled as Miss Dust looked on, shocked. "Well said, Gina." Calmly, Ella said. "I agree that the mad science community would view a tour lead by myself or the head of administrations as an attempt to sway his decision."

"I agree that you graduated at the top of your class with honors and breaking every record." Politely, Miss Dust said. "However, this particular visit holds a great significance..."

"It holds a great political significance." Frowning Ella corrected. "At first, I believed myself best suited for the task due to its delicate nature. However, I now see that it would be best if Gina lead the tour so it would be seen as a sister showing off her Alma Matter."

"Perhaps one of us should accompany them then." Offering a compromise, Miss Dust said. "At least this way we can guarantee our visitor has a pleasant tour of our fine school."

"I agree." Smiling, Ella replied. "However, I believe this falls under the jurisdiction of the school prefects; I will summon them."

With a quick phone call, four teenage girls in security uniforms entered the office with serious expressions on their faces. They spotted Joe immediately and turned to Ella. "Has this boy caused trouble on campus, madam head witch?" The first girl asked.

"Joe, this is Sue Winters, Sal Summers, Grace Fall, and Val Spring." Motioning to the girls, Ella said. "They are this school's top prefects and Soothsayer cadets."

"Soothsayer?" Confused, Joe asked.

"Witch police." Firmly but kindly, Miss Dust replied. "They are a part of the D.D.M.C. The Department of Dark Magic Control."

Ella nodded then turned to the prefects. "Ladies, I would like to introduce you to my grandson; the heir to the throne of all mad scientists, Joe Mage."

The prefects turned slightly pale as they looked at Joe then they saw you and sighed slightly. "I take it Mr Joe Mage is here for a tour with his sister." More calmly, Sal said.

"That is correct." Firmly, Ella said. "I am entrusting you four to ensure nothing unfortunate happens to our guests during their stay. As Joe told me, he wants the facts, not a sales pitch."

All four girls nodded, a bright smile forming upon their faces. "Joe and Gina Mage are in good hands, madam head witch." Saluting, Val said. "We will ensure a pleasant and informative tour."

With that said, the four teenagers lead you and Joe out of the office to begin the tour. They first took you to...
1311133.title: You are given the honor.

13111331.content:
The four prefects led you and Joe out of the administration building to another low structure where classes were held for many of the students. "Classes do not start for another few days." Politely, Val said. "However, I can assure you that learning magic is more about weaving spells and stirring up potions; it is an exact art."

Val was five foot six, slightly taller than you with shoulder length blond hair and bright blue eyes. She was quite muscular for her age, clearly a tomboy. She motioned to an empty classroom where a lone female teacher was preparing her desk for up coming lessons. "Pardon the intrusion, Ms Walker." Politely, Grace said. "We are giving a extra special guest a tour of the school."

Grace was an inch taller than Val with short brown hair and hazel eyes. She was not muscular but you could sense that her magic was very strong. Joe, as you noticed, blushed slightly at her comment but remained silent. Ms Walker was a very short, elderly woman with white hair tied into a small bun near the top of her head and deep green eyes. She was professionally dressed and carried a willow wood cane with a small crystal ball on the top. She turned to the prefects with a single eyebrow raised, carrying a curious look on her face. "Every student who comes here is special in their own way." Firmly but kindly, she said. "How do you see this one individual as extra special?"

"Allow us to introduce the heir to the throne of all mad scientists, Joe Mage." Politely, Sue said. "He is considering this school but fears a sales pitch rather than the facts."

Sue was the shortest of the group, standing at only five foot. She had mid-back black hair and green eyes. She was not strong in appearance but you sensed her magic was almost as strong as your own.

"I- I just learned about all of this today." Blushing, Joe said. "I was told I needed to make a choice but I need more facts before I can make such a life changing decision." He scuffed his feet, nervous. "I'm not more special than anyone else. Honestly, I'd rather be an athlete."

Ms Walker smiled kindly. "It is very rare to meet a humble mad scientist." Bemused, she said. "Many boys of chaotic blood almost immediately go into a mental power trip when they discover the powers they have at their command." She giggled slightly. "To be fair, I have also met young girls of witch blood who fell down the same path."

"What do you teach in your class?" Curious, Joe asked.

"I teach witching world history, Mr Mage." Firmly but kindly, Ms Walker explained. "The history of the world at large is equally important; we must know the mistakes of our past so not to repeat them."

"Can you give an example?" Showing interest, Joe asked.

"Look behind you." Smiling, Ms Walker said.

You whipped your head around just as Joe did to find the prefects holding their wands at the ready, making Joe visibly panicked and you very annoyed. "What is the meaning of this?!" Alarmed, you demanded. "What are you trying to do?!"

"Standard procedure when a mad scientist visits this school, Miss Mage." Flatly, Sal said. "It's not personal, I assure you."

Sal was the tallest of the group and nearly six foot with short auburn hair and brown eyes. She was visibly strong with strong magic as well. You knew you could take any one of them one but you were not sure about a four against one fight, if it came to that. "We're just taking a tour." Annoyed, you said. "Put those away, you are frightening my little brother."

"It's not personal." Frowning, Sal repeated.

Ms Walker stepped in between you, Joe, and the prefects. "No, its political." Sternly, she said. "The standard procedure you are referring to only applies to a boy of chaotic blood who requests a tour alone." She then frowned holding up her cane. "The laws governing this school clearly indicates that an armed escort is not required when the boy of chaotic blood is given in the company of a witch blood relative, regardless of the political status of the boy. As Soothsayer cadets, you are all required to know all the laws by memory. Put those wands away... now."

The four cadets, clearly embarrassed slowly sheathed their wands only Ms Walker was not through with them. "I am deeply disappointed in you four as this could have easily become a public relations nightmare for this school." Scolding she said. "What do you have to say in your defense, young ladies?"

The four girls fumbled for an explanation only Joe spoke out. "I believe they were working in my defense, Ms Walker." Softly, he said. "As the heir to the throne of all mad scientists, anything that happens to me could generate a backlash. Also, grandma, err, Ella, the head witch made it clear that nothing unfortunate was to happen to me."

"So you believe that their wands being drawn was an act of defense?" Raising an eyebrow, Ms Walked asked. "Interesting..."

"What?" Confused, Joe asked.

Ms Walker shook her head, bemused. "You truly are a humble person." Smiling, she said. "I am honored to have met you, young man."

"The honor is mine." Bowing slightly, Joe said.

Ms Walker giggled. "I must return to my duties but I urge you to visit the other classes and see all that we offer for yourself."

"What would you recommend, Ms Walker?" Politely, you asked.

Ms Walker thought for a moment then replied, "I would visit the..."
13111331.title: The fearless Ms Walker.

choices: Other witches want to test Joe.
You go too far, Joe gets hurt.
131113311.content:
"Entrance exam?" Gulping, Joe asked.

"It is where all students are tested to see how powerful their magic is." Smiling, Ms Walker replied. "However, visiting boys are welcome to try their hand at the exam to see how powerful their resistance or, in your case, their chaotic science is."

"Taking the entrance exam does not enroll you into the school, Joe." Reassuringly, you explained. "It is just to give the teachers and staff an idea of how powerful or resistant you are."

"I'm certain you are at least a little curious as to how strong your abilities are." Calmly, Ms Walker said. "I must admit that I am a bit curious as well. Your sister's power is very impressive."

"I guess that would be okay." Wincing, Joe said. "Who will I be facing?"

"Me, of course." Smiling, you said. "Unless you'd rather face a teacher here."

Joe quickly shook his head. "I'll face you."

Ms Walker accompanied you, Joe, and the prefects to the examination test classroom where the teacher there, Miss Flora was also preparing her room for the first group of new students. "Pardon the intrusion, Miss Flora." Kindly, Ms Walker said. "However, we have a male visitor; I convinced him to participate in an unofficial entrance exam."

Miss Flora was a short but slender young woman who looked no older than twenty. She had long honey blonde hair and piecing green eyes. "Does this curious young lad have a name?" Smiling, she asked. "Also, who will be facing him in the unofficial entrance exam?"

"Allow me to introduce my little brother, Joe Mage, Miss Flora." Smiling, you said. "He came here looking for more information about this school. I offered to face him"

Miss Flora smiled, eying Joe. "I am honored that the heir to all mad scientists has an interest in our school for magic." Kindly, she said. "The rules of the exam are simple, young man." She pointed out two circles in the room. "You and Gina will stand in their own circle. If you choose to resist, she will be firing energy blasts and spells at you in an attempt to push you out of the ring. The longer you resist, the higher you score. The test ends when you are either pushed out of the ring or you fall from exhaustion."

"If you choose to test your power, the roles are reversed." Kindly, Gina explained. "Only, you will have to use events and energy blasts you really have no training in using so Miss Flora will be running that test, if you choose that."

"Um... I think I'll stick to resistance for now." Wincing, you said. "I don't want to hurt anyone using something I don't really know how to properly use."

Miss Flora smiled. "I am pleased to see you are cautious as well as wise." Calmly, she said. "Let us begin, then. The record is two minutes and fifty seconds, set by Gina Mage. Take your places and begin!"

You and Joe walked to the circle Miss Flora pointed out and faced each other. As you prepared to test your little brother, you noticed a large group of young witches and teachers were watching from the observational windows in the halls that surrounded the classroom. Joe noticed this as well and gulped.

"Don't worry." Calmly, you said. "No one is allowed to interfere with the test."

Joe nodded but he did not seem very convinced. The test began in earnest; you fired energy blasts at Joe who, although frightened and uncertain, managed to deflect each one as they came at him. As the one minute mark passed, you intensified your attack. Although none of those that managed to hit Joe caused no damage, they pushed him back a step. Still, he managed to keep up and take the steps he lost back. As the two minute mark passed, Joe began panting from his efforts to defend his spot. You were not sure if it was your pride or the fact you had an audience but you increased the power of your hits again, not wanting your brother, a boy to beat your time, the highest in recent school history. You gave one heavy push with a large energy blast, hoping to push Joe out of the ring or, at the very least, tire him out enough to quit.
131113311.title: Entrance exam classroom.

1311133111.content:
Your last energy blast pushed Joe completely out of his ring, ending the test. Joe was sweating and panting heavily from effort but so were you; your brother was surprisingly resistant. "How did I do, Miss Flora?" Catching his breath, Joe asked.

Miss Flora glanced down at a stopwatch. "Excellence seems to run in the family." Smiling, she said. "Congratulations, Mr. Mage; you have tied the highest score in recent school history."

The girls and women watching the event cheered as you stood there with your mouth half open. "Joe tied my score?!" Stunned, you demanded. You quickly composed yourself, not wanting to become an embarrassment and smiled. "Well, I suppose one should expect as much from the heir to the throne of all mad scientists."

"Nice save, Gina." Whispering, Miss Flora said. "Jealousy is not an attractive trait for a witch."

You blushed slightly at that as Joe walked up, looking as if he had gained his second wind. "Remind me not to get on your bad side." Grinning, he said. "Better yet, pray no one gets on our bad side."

You giggled at that and gave Joe a warm hug, bringing on more cheers. Miss Flora offered Joe a small stack of papers. Sensing a trap, Joe took a step back. "What are those?"

Miss Flora giggled. "These are the results of your unofficial entrance exam." Smiling, she said. "It is required of us to offer them to everyone who participates." She then winked. "If you do decide to study here, it will be proof that you had already taken it."

Reluctantly, Joe accepted the papers but turned pale as he saw a blank registration form mixed in with the results. Seeing it, you quickly spoke up. "You only need to fill that out if you decide this school is right for you."

Joe sighed. "I still need to take a tour of Eliete Scientiam before I make any decisions." Softly, he said. "This school seems great and all but..."

Joe was interrupted by the girls watching from the halls who began to chant, "Become a witch!" over and over. You winced, seeing Joe looking around, startled; no one liked peer pressure and Joe was no exception. Miss Flora and the other teachers watching were about to break it up when suddenly, Joe yelled, "Enough!"

The room fell silent as Joe then...
1311133111.title: Joe ties your record.

13111331112.content:
You were relieved when Joe asked to continue the tour. "I'm sorry about that." Wincing, you said. "For a moment, I thought you were going to ask to leave."

Joe sighed. "They got excited, I probably would have done the same if the roles were reversed." Patiently, he said. "Only I'm not making any promises until I tour both schools."

You nodded then turned to the prefects. "I'm thinking we show Joe the extra curricular activities the school offers." Serious, you said. "His primary goal is to be an Olympic athlete."

"That is a part of the tour." Smiling, Sue replied. "However, I think it would more appropriate if he had an interview with this year's teacher's aides. They are not busy prepping classes and would have more time to answer his questions."

Sue nodded in approval. "The teacher's aides are witches who had graduated with high enough scores to learn how to become teachers of future classes." Calmly, she explained. "They can give you a better idea of what to expect from them and what would be expected of you."

"I am leaning more towards our guest actually meeting the new students themselves." Serious Val said. "By meeting young witches from all walks of life, Joe will get a better idea of what magic is all about and why this school is so important to them."

Grace nodded. "I agree but it would have to be strictly controlled." Firmly, she said. "Some young witches are not as restrained as we or the teachers."

Joe winced at that then turned to you, hoping for some advice. After a moment, he decided to be lead to see...
13111331112.title: Asked to continue the tour.

131113311123.content:
"I would like to meet the students I would work with if, and that is, if I choose to come here and learn magic as a girl." Surprising you, Joe said. "I would want to meet possible future fellow classmates at the other school as well."

Val nodded, clearly pleased with your choice. "Very well, I will arrange the meeting immediately." Smiling, she said. "We can all talk in one of the class conference rooms."

You and Joe were escorted to a large private room where you were asked to be seated. Sue, Sal, and Grace stood behind the two of you while Val escorted four young girls into the room. Val ordered them to sit down across from you and Joe.

"What's this all about?" Irritated, the first girl demanded. "School has not even started yet and the prefects already want a meeting with us?"

"Adey Marble, this is Joe Mage, heir to the throne of all mad scientists." Patiently, Val said. "He is considering this school and wished to meet the students he would be working with if he chose to come here to learn magic."

Adey looked at you and Joe. She was tall and slender but rather muscular for her age, around thirteen. She huffed. "Picky are we?"

You frowned at that but smiled as Joe countered, "Cautious. I like to know what I'm jumping into before I make a leap."

"Please excuse my friend." Smiling, the second girl said. "She's a bit protective. I'm Lena Verse; are you really thinking about becoming a girl to learn magic? I mean, it would be great if you do because we would have more girls in the class which means more fun in learning spells..."

Lena was petite but not overly so with shoulder length brown hair and green eyes. She seemed to have energy to spare with the way she was smiling and carrying on.

"It's one of the options open to me." Politely, Joe interrupted. "I like to explore all options before making a move. Especially since dad wanted a rush decision; its not my style."

"Doesn't that make your dad, well, angry?" Wincing, the third girl asked. "You are the heir to the throne so... he wouldn't want you to become a witch..."

"Dad is not crazy about the idea, no." Kindly, you said. "However, he knows that the choice is Joe's and Joe's alone."

The third girl sighed, looking down rather than at you. She was very short with doll like features. She had mid back sun blond hair and blue eyes. Adey placed a hand onto her shoulder, causing her to jump. "Sorry! I'm Lila Dove, it's a pleasure to meet you!"

Adey sighed, shaking her head. " Lila is irrationally shy." Softly, she said. "We are trying to get her to toughen up but she's got a long way to go to come out of her shell."

"Let's cut to the chase." Serious, the fourth girl said. "I'm Zeva Quest; why did you want to meet with us? What would seeing us do to sway your decision one way or the other."

Zeva was an Amazon of a girl, tall and very muscular with long black hair and green eyes. She stood with her hands on her hips, waiting for a response. She was surprised though when Joe smiled kindly at her.

"I wanted to make certain you would not treat me differently just because of my 'royal' title." Politely, he replied. He moved his fingers up and down when he said 'royal' indicating sarcasm. "I'm pleased to see you and the other girls treat me no better and no worse."

Zeva blinked then smiled slightly. "So this meeting was a test." Bemused, she said. "Interesting approach to test the waters, I must say."

Joe blushed. "It was also to test my nerve." Softly, he said. "I'm a bit out of my element here."

Zeva laughed. "I never thought I'd see a humble mad scientist." Amused, she said. "If you decide to study here, we'll help make a real woman out of you."

Joe blushed even more at that, causing the other girls to giggle. You could not help giggle a little too; your brother was not the typical mad scientist as he was mostly raised by mom. Upon leaving the meeting on good terms with the young students, you took Joe to see the extra curricular activities the school offered. Upon reaching the athletic field, a number of girls ran up to you and Joe. You recognized them as the three gossipers who saw you escorting Joe in earlier. They were running to you and Joe from...
131113311123.title: the young new students.

choices: agreed to do a few cheers.
was called away, the visit had expired.
1311133111231.content:
The three girls were wearing the Cauldron Academy cheer squad uniforms which consisted of a dark blue and white pleated skirt with a pink trim and a white blouse with dark blue stripes and pink trim on the sleeves. They ran up to Joe with bright smiles on their faces. All of them were of average height, slender, with the same long sand blond hair and ocean green eyes. It was obvious to you that they were triplets.

"Congratulations on your high score during the entrance exam!" Smiling, the first girl said. "I'm Tasha Wales; this is my sister Nina and my other sister Tessa!"

The girls nodded as they were introduced. Tasha had a pink ribbon in her hair while Nina had a light blue ribbon, and Tessa had a white ribbon. "We are the 'TNT' triplets!" Still smiling, Tasha said. "Please allow us to be the first to welcome you as a new student to our great school!"

"I have made no commitments as of yet." Firmly but politely, Joe said. "I still want to tour the other school before I make any decisions."

Tasha pouted slightly but Nina spoke up quickly. "That 'other school' as you so put it is a waste of time, in my opinion." Softly, she said. "They abandon those who are not the best." There was a sad look in her eye. You got the impression she was once a boy. "Still, I understand that you must take the tour to appease your father..."

"With all due respect, I will base my decisions on what I see when I visit." Irritation in his voice, Joe said. "Thank you anyway."

"Joe does not like to be pressured." Defending him, you said. "I think everyone gained a sense of that who watched the entire practice duel."

"Please forgive the enthusiasm my younger sisters." Politely, Tessa said. "We are honored with the task of welcoming this year's new students; we did not want to take the chance that your brother did not choose our school."

"I accept your apology." Smiling slightly, Joe said. "I am here to see your extra curricular activities, I want to see everything this school offers before visiting the other school."

"Would you like to try a few cheers with us?" Grinning, Tasha asked. She giggled. "I promise you will not be required to wear the uniform."

Joe nervously chuckled at that then turned to you. "It's up to you, bro." Shrugging, you said. "This is your visit."

Joe sighed then...
1311133111231.title: the cheer squad.

13111331112312.content:
Joe sighed then replied. "I only have so much time to see all that this school offers." He motioned to the visitor's bracelet. "Besides, I kind of want to avoid the risk of this falling off; I was afraid it was going to during the unofficial entrance exam."

The girls were visibly disappointed but seemed to understand Joe's time limit for his visit. "Would you consider the cheer squad if you decided to study here?" Hopeful, Nina asked.

Joe nodded. "If I decide to study here, I will consider it."

The three girls smiled then walked away in good spirits. "Wisely done, bro." Whispering, you said. "I think they were pleased to see you so diplomatic."

"I'm just trying to avoid an argument." Wincing, Joe said. "That and I don't want to give the staff the wrong idea by trying a few cheers."

You giggled then turned to your watch. "Our time is nearly expired." Softly, you said. "We need to head back to the administration building."

You and Joe left Cauldron academy in good spirits and returned home where mom had Joe's favorite meal ready with the table set. "Welcome home, Joe, Gina." Smiling, she said. "I want to hear all about your visit while we eat."

"Are you going to that school?" Grinning, Tia asked.

"We can give you a cute makeover before you go." Also Grinning, Ina suggested.

"It was just a visit, girls." Firmly, mom scolded. "Don't pressure him." She turned to you as everyone took their seats. "Dad will not be joining us tonight; he is getting things ready for Joe's visit to Eliete Scientiam tomorrow."

"Why would he want to get anything ready?" Curious, Tia asked.

"Cause he wants Joe to go there and not witch school." Frowning, Ina replied.

"I fear that is correct." Sighing, mom said. "But let us focus on your visit to Cauldron Academy."
13111331112312.title: politely declined.

131113311123121.content:
"Well, the students there seemed to know me right off the bat." Pouting, Joe said. "I got the impression they knew more about me than I did."

"You were a famous figure in the witching world from the day you were born." Bemused, mom explained. "Dad made certain of that; he also made certain we were all well protected."

"What do you mean?" Worried, Joe asked.

"Long story short, if an heir to his throne is not found before he passes on, the throne goes to another family." Frowning, you replied. "That's why you are so important to him."

"Actually, he can pick anyone in the Mage family clan to be his successor." Serious, mom added. "However, he made it clear he had his heart set on giving it to Joe."

"Why me?" Wincing, Joe asked.

"That's something you would have to ask him, sweetie." Sighing, mom said. She then smiled. "Enough of that. I want to hear about your visit."

Between mouthfuls, you and Joe described your visit with mom listening intently, hanging onto every word. Ina and Tia listened in as well though they seemed less interested. When you were done, mom giggled with delight. "It sounds like you had an enchanted time." Clearly pleased, she said. "I hope Gina wasn't too jealous that you tied her record breaking score in the unofficial entrance exam."

"She was diplomatic about it." Smiling, Joe said.

"As were you with administrations, the prefects, the teachers and the students." Grinning, you said. "Everyone mentioned they were honored to meet a 'humble mad scientist'."

Mom laughed slightly as Joe blushed. "I take a little pride in raising you right." Smiling, she said. "You truly made me proud, Joe."

Joe blushed more, trying to hide a smile. "I was just being myself."

"Did you like the school?" Jumping in, Ina asked.

"I bet he did." Grinning Tia added.

The two girls laughed, seeing Joe's face. "He's blushing so bad!" Amused, Ina exclaimed. "He did like the tour!"

"We're getting a new sister!" Overjoyed, Tia shouted.

Joe blushed more and moved to excuse himself from the table but you quickly jumped in. "Maybe you two would like to take a tour of Eliete Scientiam with Joe tomorrow." Sternly, you suggested. "Perhaps one of you would be swayed into becoming a boy to train there when you come of age."

Mom winced at that but quickly hid it as she saw the desired result; silence from the twins. Their little celebration was immediately halted and they were both blushing themselves. "The future is not set in stone, girls." Kindly, she said. "Yes, Joe might choose to train at Cauldron Academy and become a witch but then he might not." She smiled. "Save your celebration until after he makes his decision."

Knowing you had to say something to lighten the mood, you turned to Ina and Tia. "To be fair, I think Joe would have looked cute in the cheer uniform."

Mom and the twins immediately fell into tearful laughter while Joe again blushed terribly. Only, he saw your attempt at humor and laughed with you. He truly was humble; you just hoped his tour of Eliete Scientiam will not change that.
131113311123121.title: Joe talks about his visit.

choices: The front gates of Elite Scientiam.
Thomas and Rachel over for a visit.
1311133111231211.content:
The next morning, you woke up to the sound of your alarm, set at mom's request. You sleepily got up and headed for the bathroom. After freshening up, you walked down the stairs into the living room where you spotted dad in what looked like an expensive black tuxedo. Draped over it was a long bright white lab coat, making him look ridiculous. Dad smiled at your expression. "Every culture has its own definition of 'formal dress code', my dear daughter." Calmly, he said. "This is ours." He then smiled, adding, "You had better get ready; we will be leaving soon."

This surprised you. "What..."

Mom sighed. "The witch council and the mad science think tank agree that there is a conflict of interest between your father and I." Patiently, she explained. "Therefore, as the eldest daughter, you must accompany Joe on the tour of Elite Scientiam and report to me."

"The conflict rises from the students and teachers attempting to use peer pressure to get Joe to sign up for the school." Serious, dad added. "I requested a full report in complete detail upon hearing of your tour of Cauldron Academy."

"Joe did not yield to the pressure." Frowning, you countered.

"I am proud of him for his ability to take the pressure and not yield." Smiling, dad said. "Your presence during this tour will ensure the students of Elite Scientiam do not repeat the mistake." He then grinned, adding, "I can only hope you have the same strength of character."

You rolled your eyes, knowing dad had some agenda in mind. You decided not to comment and instead ate breakfast before getting dressed for the tour of the mad science school. As you were getting dressed, mom knocked on your door and carefully entered.

"Remain on your guard, Gina." Quietly, she said. "I have a suspicion that your father may try to sway you to train at Elite Scientiam as well."

"Why?" Worried, you asked.

"Because you are the first born." Wincing, mom said. "While it is only required for the first born son to become the heir to the throne, it is considered a great victory if the first born daughter is swayed into becoming a mad scientist."

You gulped at that and nodded, understanding mom's concern. Once you were ready, dad smiled madly before opening the front door, revealing...
1311133111231211.title: The next morning.

13111331112312111.content:
Just beyond the front door, instead of the front yard, you spotted a grand set of gates leading onto a vast courtyard with a long path to a massive castle about a hundred yards away. "Our tour begins at the front gates, just as it began with your tour at Cauldron academy." Kindly, dad said. "Please be aware that Gina will have to wear a visitor bracelet for the duration of the tour."

With that, he summoned a bracelet with a number of lights and odd designs on it and clamped it onto your wrist with a soft click. The device hissed and tightened itself to the point it would be impossible to remove without unlocking the mechanism. He then turned to Joe and repeated the process. "I take it that this will protect us from becoming students." Frowning, you said.

Dad nodded. "It is forbidden for a mad scientist, especially the head mad scientist, to lie about such minor things." Serious, he said. "It is illogical to do so and not the behavior of a true gentleman." He motioned to the bracelet. "It will come off once you have returned home."

"It also records everything said and done." Chiming in, mom warned. "Just as the visitor bracelet does; so to review the visit in case of any incidents."

"I was getting to that." Frowning, dad said. "A fact you withheld from my dear son."

Joe huffed. "Are we going to visit this school or have a love tiff?" Irritable, he demanded. "Last I checked, I only have a few days to decide so kindly make up your minds."

Dad grinned. "I see you are still grumpy in the morning." Teasing, he said. "We shall begin the tour the moment you step foot out the door."

You quickly glanced back at mom as you followed dad out the door with Joe. She gave you a weak smile as she waved goodbye just as the front door was closed shut. The second that happened, the door vanished and you were all standing at the front gates of Elite Scientiam. Dad waved to a lone guard at the gate who smiled before opening the gates.

"This is a pleasant surprise, your kingship." Politely, he said.

"I am here on official business, Mr Thorn." Serious, dad announced. "My son wishes to take a tour of our school of excellence. My eldest daughter is with him as an observer to ensure there are no conflicts forcing his decision one way or the other."

Mr Thorn grinned madly, his eerie yellow eyes glowing through his longish auburn hair. "What fine specimens you have brought forth into this world!" Eying you and Joe, he said. "You should be proud, head mad scientist!"

"Pride is a dangerous emotion, Mr Thorn." Frowning deeply, dad scolded. "It can blind you to any mistakes that stand right in front of you."

You winced at that, wondering what dad meant by that. Only dad was not done. "That is what brought you down from head master to a lowly gate guard." He scowled at the guard, adding, "Make no mistake; you must earn your way back to your former position; flattery is no shortcut to redemption."

The guard bowed his head, silent as dad then lead you and Joe through onto the grounds. "What was that all about?" Worried, you demanded.

"We mad scientists are responsible for every mistake we make, regardless of how insignificant it may seem." Darkly, dad replied. "It was because of a miscalculation on the part of both witches and mad scientists that forever stranded hundreds of our kind in this world." He sighed. "It was unanimously agreed by the new mad science think tank that any mistake uncorrected can and will cascade into disaster. We will not be a part of any repeat of the tragedies past mistakes."

"I see..." Gulping, you said.

Dad smiled. "It is nothing for you to concern yourself too much with." Reaching the main doors, he said. "Let us begin this tour on an uplifting note."

The two heavy doors were opened by a pair of heavily armed guards and you entered with Joe and dad at your side. Just beyond the doors, you found yourself in an immense grand hall. Large elaborate gold chandeliers lit the scene as you looked down to the end to find a wide staircase that branched off into two directions to the floor above.

"We march straight ahead to administrations to log in as visitors." Smiling, dad said. "Stay close and try not to be distracted by the sights; we will take them all in soon enough."

You and Joe shuddered hearing screams and moans echoing from the many halls followed by the mad laughter of hundreds of people from all directions. Seeing your reaction, dad placed a gentle hand onto your shoulder. "The screams and moans you hear are actually the sirens that mark the end of a school day." Smiling, he said. "You only hear screams and moans because you are not a student."

"I thought classes don't begin for a few days." Taken back, you said.

"The first semester for first year students do not begin for a few days." Grinning, he said. "Students have been known to train here well into adulthood depending upon their goals in life." He chuckled. "The screams and moans are to scare away the curious should they sneak passed the gate guards."

With that, dad opened a door marked 'administrations'. "Shall we...?"

With a sigh, you walked into the administrations office with Joe and dad following.
13111331112312111.title: The front gates of Elite Scientiam.

131113311123121111.content:
Beyond the door to the administration building, you were surprised to see yet another courtyard which lead to a small series of low level buildings. "What..."

Dad chuckled. "Administrations is for more than just new young students." Kindly, he explained. "We also train adult mad scientists to become professors; it requires a certain level of patience." He motioned to another building. "We have a separate administration buildings to handle curious witches, such as yourself, who wish to take an introductory course."

"I am only here to accompany Joe on his tour." Taken back, you said.

"Which is why we are going to the visitor administration center." Simply, dad said. "I am merely pointing out the reason for multiple buildings."

"You look as jumpy as I felt while touring Cauldron academy, sis." Wincing, Joe said.

"For the same reasons." Softly, you replied.

"The unknown is only feared until it becomes known." Smiling, dad said. "Come..."

As you walked nervously at dad's side with Joe, you spotted a number of boys of various ages looking your way. More than a few raised a single eyebrow while a few others smiled. Thanks to your magically enhanced senses, you could not help hear some of their whispered comments.

"The head mad scientist's son has come of age." Grinning, one boy said. "Only note who is with him; the granddaughter of the head witch herself." He chuckled madly. "Do I detect a conflict of interest playing out here?"

"His son has no doubt toured Cauldron Academy." Grinning back, another boy commented. "Otherwise, there would have been no need for his eldest daughter to accompany them."

A third boy madly chuckled. "Unless the father saw an opportunity to sway his eldest daughter to add mad science to her educational interests." Bemused, he said. "We may have another student in the first year dorms before classes begin."

You winced at that as similar things were said during Joe's tour of your school. Dad took notice of the comments and smiled at you. "They are naturally curious, Gina." Kindly, he whispered. "Try not to take offense to their theories as to why you are here."

You managed a weak smile as dad opened the door to a low building near the center of the courtyard and ushered you and Joe in. He followed you both in and closed the door behind him. There, you found yourself in a spacious room where two men were having a conversation about the new students. They stopped upon taking notice of dad, you, and Joe. The first man was dressed in a black suit with a white lab coat over it, like dad. They were twins; both of average height and weight with longish red hair, tied into a single braid, and green eyes.

"Ah, Sir Geo." Smiling, the first man said. "I see your son had come of age." He took notice of the bracelet on both yours and Joe's wrist. "Who shall be bestowed the honor of giving your curious offspring the grand tour?"

"It is obvious that the head mad scientist wishes to give the tour himself, Mr Tom Yin." Calmly the second man said. "Otherwise, he would have sent an escort from our fine establishment to accompany the lad and his sister."

"Your logic is flawed, Mr. Tim Yang." Patiently, Yin countered. "For the head mad scientist to offer the tour, regardless of the fact he is the children's father, would create a PR nightmare on the political stage."

Dad chuckled. "Administrators, please." Calmly, he said. "This tour shall be run by..."
131113311123121111.title: Students take notice of you.

1311133111231211111.content:
The second dad said this, a familiar looking muscular boy entered the room. He was near your height with longish brown hair and blue eyes. He wore a suit similar to dad with a long white lab coat over it. "Hey, Gina." Smiling, he said. "Welcome to my Alma Mater."

"Thomas?!" Stunned, you asked. "You're a mad scientist?!"

"The first of my blood line, I might ad." Proudly, Thomas replied. "That and the top of my class." He chuckled slightly. "If you think you are shocked by this development, you should have seen the faces of my colleagues."

"Mr Thomas Lore has broken new ground in many ways." Smiling, dad said. "Very few first born mad scientists ever obtain the power he now possesses let a lone learn how to focus it with such surgical precision."

"In honor of Joe Mage's request, I will be showing you all this unique school has to offer without the sales pitch." Serious, Thomas said. "I do not wish to harm the relationship we mutually enjoy."

"You were not forthcoming with me about your power, Thomas." Frowning, you said.

"No more than you were forthcoming about your own." Grinning, Thomas countered. "You know the rule regarding revealing one's powers."

You sighed. "Good point."

"The prefects will be monitoring your progress and will only intervene when necessary." Serious, dad said. He turned to Thomas. "You have two hours; beginning now."

Thomas nodded then motioned to the door. "Shall we...?"
1311133111231211111.title: this year's top student.

choices: I already chose a school, you pick.
13111331112312111111.content:
Thomas led us out of the visitor administrations building through another door that lead back to the main hall. "The doors are actually jump gates from one part of the school to another." Serious, Thomas explained. "It keeps uninvited guests from getting too far into the school and risking unnecessary injury."

"What's our first stop?" Curious, Joe asked.

Thomas smiled. "We fist visit one of the classrooms." Kindly, Thomas replied. "There is no time to visit them all but I offer you a choice of three studies that are at the core of mad science."

"Which are...?" Curious, you asked.

Thomas smiled. "Chaotic energy control, Mental discipline, and Magical balance."

"Magical balance?" Raising an eyebrow, you asked. "Why do you teach that?"

Thomas chuckled. "There are individuals like Joe and yourself who have magic and chaotic energy within them due to their genealogical history." Bemused, he replied. "That said, the power those individuals do not use still needs an outlet so a balance must be maintained to keep their desired gender and power of choice."

"I didn't know that." Taken back, you said.

"That was what your resistance against chaos class was for." Smiling, Thomas said. "To balance the two powers so you would keep your powers of magic and female form." He then turned to Joe. "Which class would you like to visit, Mr Mage?"

Joe bit his lip, turning to you. He seemed to sense your curiosity. "What do you think, sis?" Wincing, he asked. "This is kind of your tour too."

What do you say...?
13111331112312111111.title: The tour begins.

choices: You agree to try a test flame.
131113311123121111112.content:
"I think we'd both be interested in seeing the magical balance class." Politely, you said.

Joe nodded in agreement. "Let's look at that class first."

"This way then." Kindly, Thomas said. "Be mindful of the halls; they tend to move."

"Move?" Curious, you asked. "Why?"

"To further slow down and discourage uninvited guests." Smiling, Thomas replied. "The light flicker in a specific pattern before they swap places. Just remain close and we will not get separated."

Thomas' words were not so comforting as you and Joe followed him up a flight of stairs to the second floor where they reached long hall of doors. Thomas walked passed the various doors, all which looked the same.

"How do you know one class from the other?" Wincing, Joe asked. "None of the doors are marked and they all look the same." He winced. "Also, what is with the red lights?"

"Another precaution." Serious, Thomas said. "Those who enroll here all have a talent for numbers and directions. Each room is marked with a specific letter and number code etched into the woodwork above each door. The lights above the doors indicate a lecture taking place. A knock is required before entry when the light is on."

He pointed to one door where you spotted 'MB1' in the frame above it. The light above was off for the moment. "'MB1' must mean first class of magical balance." Raising an eyebrow, Joe said.

"Very good, Mr Mage." Smiling, Thomas said. "That is exactly what it means." He opened the door for you and Joe. "Guests first."

You followed Joe inside where you were greeted by a full room of boys and a teacher in the middle of a lecture. "Forgive the unannounced visit, my most patient and humble professor." Grinning, Thomas said. "I have been given the honor to guide Joe Mage and his curious sister on a tour of our prestigious school of epic higher learning."

The professor grinned. He was tall and slender with a bald head and green eyes. He wore jeans and a T-shirt with a long white lab coat over it. "Welcome, noble visitors to my humble class of magical balance." Bowing, he said. "I am professor Bull Shields; you have sadly just missed my students comically failing to produce a magical test flame."

"Wouldn't producing a magical flame trap you as a girl and a witch?" Wincing, Joe asked.

"Actually, both side can hide their strength very well, looking like average teenagers and adults." Bemused, Grace said. "They both find it amusing to see the look on a person's face when they reveal their true selves."

"Are the Amazons and Ironclads allies or rivals?" Wincing, Jessica asked.

"They have a Nonaggression Pact, Jessica." Smiling, Grace said. "Just like the Ironclads, the Amazons have their own leadership through negotiations with the mad science collective and both sides work closely to maintain the peace between witches and mad scientists."
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.title: Classes begin.

choices: turned everyone but Jessica into a boy.
summoned a boy to the class.
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.content:
"How can you tell if you are a witch, mad scientist, Ironclad, or Amazon?" Curious, Jessica asked. "Is there some form of test that determines that?"

Grace smiled. "Very good, Jessica." Calmly, she said. "Yes, there is a test to determine which power you possess and you have already taken it."

"I have?" Confused, Jessica asked. "When?"

"The entrance exam." Smiling, you replied. "You are almost exactly between the powers of a witch and a mad scientist." You then sighed, adding, "Hence the 'tug of war' between mom and dad."

"You are not the only child to experience the tug of war between parents of different powers." Bemused, Grace said. "That brings us to our first lesson, learning the two centers of magics."

"Magic is centered in the uterus, something boys do not have." Adey said.

Grace nodded. "You are half right." Smiling, Grace replied. "Boys of chaotic blood possess an organ where the uterus would rest in a female body which they call the phantom womb. It is an energy producing organ that powers their magic." She giggled. "If they were to be turned into a girl, that same organ would become a real uterus."

"Interesting." Thoughtful, Lila said. "Do mad scientists find their centers in the same way as witches or is it different?"

Grace grinned. "Since you asked, why not see for yourself?"

You inwardly sighed. "Always ask the right question for the right answer."

With a wave of her hand, Grace...
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.title: the next lesson begins.

choices: A new student joins the class.
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.content:
In an instant, Lila transformed into a boy. She, or rather, he did not notice it at first but let out a surprised yelp and shut his eyes as if the light suddenly hurt. Only, as he cried out, he covered his ears, letting out another yelp of pain. Rose stepped in and gently guided him to a chair.

"Sit down... Lilo." Softly, Grace said. "I will change you back shortly."

She then turned to the class. "As you can see, Lilo discovered that, as a boy, his senses are far more acute. The light in the room hurt his eyes and his own yelp hurt his ears. This is how changing a witch into a boy can and will disorient 'him' unless your learn to harness and control your dormant powers." She turned back to Lilo. "Find your center, as you would as a girl then command it forth in the form of a glowing sphere rather than a flame."

"Why not a flame?" Curious, Lilo whispered.

Grace smiled, hearing Lilo's whisper as normal talking. "He would make a powerful Ironclad." Bemused, she thought. "Hopefully the Ironclads won't figure that out."

"You could summon a flame." Smiling, she replied. "However, most mad scientists prefer the sparkling sphere as it allows them more uses than gauging their power but we will discuss that another day. Please do as I instructed."

Lilo nodded then, with some effort, managed to summon a glowing, sparkling sphere to his hand that slowly rotated above his hand. "I did it!" Surprised, he said. He then covered his ears again, wincing at the power of his new voice. "Ow!"

Grace then returned Lila back to normal and turned to the class. "This is also why transformed boys find themselves unable to hear or see well as a girl." Serious, she explained. "They lose those acute senses they were used to having as witches need to summon those powers to bear where witch boys have them naturally."
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.title: turned Lila into a boy.

choices: At home, Thomas finds you missing.
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.content:
"What of the girls born in chaotic families?" Curious, Jessica asked. "Do they face the same problems as transformed boys?"

Grace nodded. "They do indeed." Serious, she replied. "When a chaotic blood girl is transformed into a boy, they feel blind, deaf and weak. Like witches, mad scientists have to summon those acute senses to bear where their female counterparts have them naturally."

"Are chaotic girls stronger than mad scientists?" Wincing, Lila asked.

"They are physically stronger, yes." Serious, Grace replied. "However, they are raised not to use that strength unless absolutely necessary due to the gentleman's code."

"Real women can do everything on their own but real men do not let them." Reciting dad's favorite quote, you said. "That is the gentleman's code."

Grace giggled. "Witches are trained to allow their sons and brothers to do the heavy lifting so to better hide their abilities from the outside world." Bemused, she said. "Mad scientists are trained to do the heavy lifting for the girls so to protect their secret as well as their own."

"I thought you said that chaotic girls were stronger." Confused, Tessa said.

"I did but that does not mean mad scientists are weak." Serious, Grace replied. "Never underestimate either power. Those born with a mad scientist father and witch mother are not effected by such transformations except for not having training in their dormant power." She smiled. "Moving on, then..."
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.title: The lesson continues.

choices: Back to you and your class.
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.content:
Unknown to you, while Miss Grace continued her lecture on the five powers of the world, Thomas visited your house, concerned. Fortunately, mom had changed reality for a time, making everyone believe Joe was really Jessica. "Gina nor Jess showed up for school today." Worried, he said. "Did something happen? Are they okay?"

"You have nothing to fear, Mr. Thomas Lore." Calmly, mom said. "Both Gina and Jessica are attending a special school for the year." She giggled. "It's rather exclusive and frowns upon visitors too early in the year."

"A special school?" Wincing, Thomas asked. "Surely you do not mean..."

"Indeed." Smiling, dad said. "Although it is not my first choice for Jess, it will hopefully be the first step to a more promising future."

"Where is this school?" Curious, Thomas demanded. "Why would you two send them there?"

"It's rather involved and will take much time to explain." Bemused, mom said. "Just know that they are both safe and will come back at the end of the year."

Thomas shook his head. "You are both hiding something." Frowning, he said. "What happened to Gina and Jess? Where are they?"

"We told you the truth, dear boy." Smiling, dad said. "Jessica is going to the same school Gina left to for the year and Gina went with her as a teacher's aide."

Thomas huffed. "Cauldron Academy." Softly, he said. "Gina told me a little about the place in her letters last year." He frowned deeper. "They have the same strict rules regarding visitors as my Alma Matter, Elite Scientiam."

"I strongly advise you do not go for a visit, young man." Serious, mom said. "You will never see the world the same way again if you go there."

"I will inform Gina and Jessica that you are concerned about them and have them write." Grinning, dad said. "Until then, off with you, now."

Thomas left the house, worried but his jaws locked in decision. After he had left, dad turned to mom with an almost sinister grin on his face. "Thomas is brilliant but he lacks experience." Bemused, he said. "I suspect Gina and Jessica will have a new classmate before the end of this day."

Mom merely smiled, shaking her head.
1311133111231211111121222222323331144311.title: At home, Thomas finds you missing.

choices: with silence, he had passed out.
1311133113.content:
