You watched as Joe was lead to one of the chairs where Miss Eve began to wash her hair. You giggled, seeing her expression melt into a slight grin, while you and mom took chairs of your own and allowed your own treatments to begin.

"One thing." Calmly, mom said. "Nothing overly girlish for Joeanna; it was part of the agreement to get her here."

Miss Eve nodded. "Beautiful but not overly girlish; got it."

As the treatments continued, you kept a weary eye on Joe, hoping that mom's plan to get her to relax before shopping does not backfire on her. After the shampoo treatment came hair styling, nail filing and painting, then a light makeover. At first, Joe protested but Miss Eve assured him that everything easily washes off. Still hesitant, Joe reluctantly agreed. When the treatments were done, Miss Eve turned Joe's chair to a wall mirror. "Well, what do you think?" Smiling, she asked. "Are you cute or what?"

Joe stared at himself in the mirror, a stunned look on her face. “What have they done to me?”

The delicate layers of make-up gave her face an angel like glow. The light shade of soft pink on her lips and the small shimmering diamonds Miss Eve slipped onto her earlobes enhanced the effect greatly. The bright ivory color painted onto her fingernails went well with the ivory sash on the simple dress she was wearing. The simple long, flowing southern belle hairstyle Miss Eve had given her finished the look.

She turned to you and mom, uncertain. Both you and mom had similar looks, making her and you look very attractive. "You look very pretty, honey." Gushing, mom said.

You tried to hide your worry as you asked Joe, "What do you think of your new look, over all?"

Joe's lips quivered slightly before she stated, "I don't know whether to thank you or strangle you." With a pout, she said. "I have to admit, the girl in the mirror looks cute but now that girl is going to be chased by practically every boy in the mall." She sighed then whispered. "This 'training' better be worth all the trouble."

You released a breath, relieved that Joe did not demand to be sent home. "It's worth it, sis." Smiling, you said. "Also, don't worry, we'll keep the boys at bay." You giggled. "Still, I think I'm way prettier than you."

Joe looked at you as if she had been insulted. "Hey!" He paused. "Wait a minute..."

You, mom and Miss Eve laughed, causing Joe to blush brightly, making her look even more cute.
152112133321312212.title: Mom stops somewhere first.

choices: Two teenage boys coming your way.
1521121333213122121.content:
Upon arriving at the mall, you led your reluctant new sister into teen girls clothing department with mom following close behind. Joe looked about, increasingly self confident. "I remember how nervous Gina was coming here after her first salon treatment." Smiling, mom said. "She acted very much like you are now, Joe."

Joe blushed slightly. "If you know how it feels..." Pouting, she said.

"You need to build confidence to learn magic quickly." Whispering, you said. "While I agree that mom's methods are unusual, they have a way of working."

Joe winced at that then turned to mom who smiled kindly. "I am aware that what a girl finds relaxing is very different for that of a boy." Softly, she said. "However, try to think of it this way; girls show off new outfits like boys show off new toys. It's their was of being the envy of all of their friends."

"That's weird." Wincing, Joe said. "Clothing trends change all the time."

"That's the point." Giggling, you said. "It's a constant competition."

"Also, there is always a new toy to obtain." Smiling, mom added. "It's the same competition, just different objectives to become the envy of all."

"What if you don't want to be the envy of them all?" Frowning, Joe asked.

"You will want to at least attempt to be the envy of all unless you want to stick out like a sore thumb and be singled out by the gossip group." Serious, you replied. "Girls can be vicious, more so than boys. You will want to blend in at school."

Joe threw you a panicked look. "I'm going to school like this?!"

"Just to see if you can handle it." Serious, mom said. "We'll talk about it more once we get home; I promise we are not trying to push you away."

Joe sighed, visibly rattled. "Let's get this over with." Tearing up, he said. "I don't think I can take too many more surprises."

You led you to the first rack of clothes and began to pick out the first outfit for Joe to try on when you spotted movement out of the corner of your eye. Turning, you frowned seeing...
1521121333213122121.title: At the mall.

15211213332131221212.content:
"Hey, Gina." Kindly, Rachel said. She turned to Joe. "Who is this?"

"This is our cousin, Joeanna." Smiling, mom said. "She is visiting us for the week or so while Joe is off visiting her family out east." She turned to Joe. "Joe, this is Thomas Lore and Rachel Scott."

"P-Pleased to meet you." nervous, you said. "Joe told me a lot about you guys."

"He never mentioned you, though." Raising an eyebrow, Rachel said.

"Of course he did." waving her hand, you countered. "Don't you remember? Joe and Joeanna had been pen pal cousins for months now."

"Now that you mention it, I do remember Joe showing us the letters she sent him." Blankly, Rachel muttered. She shrugged it off and changed the subject. "What brings you all to the mall?"

"They want me to get out of my tomboy phase." Pouting, Joe answered.

You and Rachel giggled. "There's nothing wrong with getting in touch with your feminine side." Amused, you said. "We're sticking to our agreement not to make you overly girlish."

You held back a giggle. Joe was liking magic, it was just the prerequisite of being a girl she was not too keen about. "She is going to learn more about herself today than she thinks." Smiling, you thought. "Just as I learned more about myself as a boy for a week during my own training at Cauldron Academy."

In home room, the teacher, Miss Thorn, briefly introduced Joe to the class and had him say something about himself. As expected, she was a bit nervous but it went rather smooth over all and you hoped the same will be said for the rest of the day.
152112133321312212121213324213222.title: The next day, at school.

1521121333213122121212133242132222.content:
During classes, you became more and more wary as you noticed some of the girls taking notice and interest in Joe. One girl in particular was Lydia Rune. She was tall and slender with shoulder length brown hair and blue eyes. She had a reputation of misleading people without breaking any rules of conduct. You and Lydia were rivals even before you went to Cauldron Academy as you ran against her for student body president. You had won but going to witch school allowed her to win due to your 'temporary transfer'. Lydia's student body council was literally all made up of witches but that did not last under father's scrutiny. Now there was a balance of witches and mad scientists, another reason you and Lydia were rivals.

At lunch, you and Joe sat at an isolated table to talk only Lydia invited herself and one other student council member to sit with you, a mad scientist named Josh Gary. He was of average height with crew cut black hair and brown eyes. He was always professionally dressed, making him stand out like a soar thumb at school. You were about to urge Joe to move to another table when Lydia spoke. "If I wanted to cause you trouble, I would have come alone, Mage." Ice in her voice, she said. "This is official council business."

"I highly doubt it." Frowning, you said. "This is a family affair of which you both know well the council is forbidden to interfere in."

"We wish to determine the nature of this family affair." Bluntly, Josh said. "Is this magic resistance training or a love tiff between your mother and father?"

"Both." Frowning, Joe said. "I am learning magic for a week as Joeanna then I will learn mad science for a week shortly after a rest to determine which is more to my liking."

You sighed. Joe was always a little too honest for her own good. Upon hearing this, Lydia grinned while Josh frowned. "So you are the proverbial coin that lands upon its side." Softly, he said. "That complicates things."

"You are so dramatic, Josh." Grinning, Lydia said. "It's simple, really. If you remain a girl, you will become the next head witch ahead of your sister." She frowned. "If you stay a boy, you will become the next head mad scientist after your father."

"Not quite." Serious, Josh said. "If you are permanently changed into the female state against your will, then you become the next heir ahead of your sister. If you choose to be female, you do not jump up in line." He smiled. "As a boy and heir to the chaotic throne, you will gain great power and respect as opposed to just being a silly little witch."

This sparked an argument between the two prompting Joe to leave the table. You quickly followed him out of the cafeteria to a small bench outside where he sat down.

"I'm so confused..." Tearfully, he muttered.

You winced, not knowing what to say. It was true that you left out the forced and not forced aspects of becoming a witch but you feared that would frighten Joe away from even trying magic at all. "Do you want to talk about this?" Softly, you asked.

Joe shook her head. "I just need time to think."
1521121333213122121212133242132222.title: Something happens.

15211213332131221212121332421322222.content:
After lunch, you became more uneasy as you saw both Lydia Rune and Josh Gary talking to their allies in school. "Be ready for anything, Joe." Whispering carefully, you said. "I have a feeling one of those two is going to try something."

Joe gulped then nodded. "Maybe we should just go home after the last bell." Nervous, Joe whispered back. "Mom can just summon what we need from our lockers."

You agreed and, once the final bell rang, you and Joe made a bee line for the exit. Only you found that Lydia Rune and her little group of friends were waiting for you. "Try to understand, Joeanna." Flatly, Lydia said. "This this is for the best."

"Cease and desist, Rune!" Angrily, Josh called. "You are out of line!"

You and Joe turned to find Josh and his own friends on the other side of the hall. Not surprisingly, the hall was completely empty of normal people. Lydia frowned. "We are doing what must be done to preserve our world, mad scientist." Firmly, she said. "Joe is the last in the line of the most powerful mad scientists."

"And you speak of preservation." Frowning back, Josh said. "We mad scientists did not ask to come here but now that we are, we are here to stay."

"We shall see about that." Summoning a flame, Lydia said.

Josh summoned a sparkling, spinning sphere to his own hand, signalling a duel between the two with you and Joe in the middle. You were about to protest when two figures arrived.
15211213332131221212121332421322222.title: The day gets worse.

choices: Joe wants mom and dad to explain.
152112133321312212121213324213222221.content:
Your friend Rachael Scott appeared between you, Joe and the mad scientists while Thomas Lore appeared between you, Joe and the witches. "This is an unauthorized conflict, mad scientists." Serious, Rachael said. "Disengage before I am forced to call upon the Correction officers."

"You have no authority or right to engage in this duel, witches." Sternly, Thomas said. "Move along unless you wish to explain your actions to the Soothsayers."

"We will disengage... Amazon." Frowning, Josh Gary replied. "However, know that your authority is limited in this case."

"You have no authority at all in this case." Frowning, Rachael countered. "Would you like to make the call or should I do it for you?"

"You win this one... Ironclad." Glaring at Thomas, Lydia said. "Only this is just the beginning."

"One call can end it for you, witch." Serious, Thomas fired back. "It is the task of the Ironclads and Amazons to protect the peace."

Grumbling, the witches and mad scientists both walked away and vanished from sight. Once they were gone, Thomas and Rachael escorted you and Joe out of the building. "You two are caught up in this mess too?!" Distraught, Joe demanded. "Someone better start talking or our agreement is off!"

Thomas and Rachael turned to each other, surprised then turned to you. "Joe has not been fully briefed on the situation?" Accusing, Thomas demanded. "What is wrong with you and your mother?"

"We were hoping to bring him up to speed slowly." Wincing, you said. "It's a lot to take in."

"Well, you need to step it up." Serious, Rachael said. "The chess game is getting serious and Joe here is a key piece in anyone's victory."

Joe sighed tearfully. "Please... what is going on?!"

You sighed, leading Joe to a bench. "Sit down and we will explain."
152112133321312212121213324213222221.title: Rachel Scott and Thomas Lore.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211.content:
"There are five forces that control this world." Calmly, you said. "You know about witches and mad scientists and a little about your role between them."

"I know that dad is the head mad scientist and wants to pass his knowledge onto to me so I can take his place someday." Frowning, Joe said. "That and mom is next in line to be crowned the next head witch." He glared at you. "Only you left out the part that I would have to be changed against my will to become the heir ahead of you."

"It is a law to make witches, especially of royal blood, to think twice before toying with their male siblings." Wincing, you said. "I didn't want to scare you."

"How am I key piece in this 'chess game' as you called it, Thomas?" Frowning, Joe demanded. "Also what is an Ironclad or an Amazon?"

"First, and Ironclad is a witch born boy whose magic had taken root but is physically too powerful for the magic to break the barrier that is keeping him male." Serious, Thomas explained. "This gives the witch born boy incredible attributes, acute senses, and limited magic powers."

"Second, an Amazon is a chaotic blood born girl whose chaotic energy has taken root but is physically too powerful for that energy to break the barrier that is keeping them female." Serious, Rachael added. "It grants the girl the same powers as an Ironclad only witches do not consider it real magic as we were born from mad scientist blood."

"You were born of chaotic and witch blood." Patiently, you said. "As such, you could potentially become any of the four powers we described."

"As such, you would tip the balance any way." Softly, Thomas said. "Thus all the fuss over you, the power you possess is phenomenal."

"What of Gina or the twins?" Wincing, Joe asked.

"Gina has already chosen her path and the twins are too young yet." Calmly, Rachael replied. "No one is really allowed to interfere with your decision but that does not stop them from trying so stay on your toes as you learn magic."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211.title: You explain.

15211213332131221212121332421322222111.content:
Upon arriving home, you found that Joe was less enthusiastic about learning magic. You had a feeling it was because there was no real reward at the end of it all other than as Josh called it a 'silly witch'. You informed mom of what had happened at the school and of Thomas and Rachael telling Joe more of the story.

"I had hoped this would not start so soon." Frowning, mom said. "Prince Thomas and princess Rachael complicated things though they did prevent a conflict."

"Wait, prince Thomas?!" Shocked, Joe demanded. "Princess Rachael?!" She shook her head, her face turning red. "I want to know everything or I march straight to father!"

Mom sighed, a pained look on her face. "There is a lot to cover, we were simply letting you into the loop slowly so it would not be as mind blowing." Patiently, she explained. "Thomas is the heir to the throne of the Ironclads and Rachael is the heir to the throne of the Amazons."

"What of the law regarding forced and willing transformations?" Frowning, Joe asked. "It seems to me that you just want another daughter to spite dad."

"That law has not been enforced in decades." Softly, mom said. "Today, its more of a wives tale that plays on a witch's pride." She smiled. "No witch relishes the thought of being made second to their brother."

"I'll admit that I am not keen on the idea of you becoming a mad scientist." Glumly, you said. "Dad is rarely around so mom had to almost literally raise us on her own."

Joe frowned at that which you expected but you did not expect her response. "That's why I let mom show me magic first." Serious, she said. "Still, was it worth the risk to keep all of this from me? What are you two afraid of?"

"We were only given seven days to show you a world you know nothing about." Serious, mom argued. "That is really not enough time to open your eyes to everything so we had to focus only on the benefits of being a girl and a witch."

"The crown goes to the one royal family member the reigning head witch deems the most worthy, Joe." Softly, you added. "You are showing a lot of potential."

"It's not about the throne." Blushing, Joe said. "It's about being honest with me." She sighed. "If my decision is so important to so many, I need to know everything to make the right decision so... no more secrets, okay?"

Mom sighed. "Okay."

Joe turned to you and you nodded as well. "Okay."

Joe's training continued from there until dad declared dinner was ready. As you walked down to the table, you frowned upon seeing...
15211213332131221212121332421322222111.title: Keeping Secrets.

152112133321312212121213324213222221112.content:
You were shocked and angered to not only see Josh Gary in your home but talking to dad with papers in hand. Dad's expression was dark as he took notice of you. "We will finish this at a later time, Mr Gary." Flatly, he said. "I need to see to my daughter."

Josh nodded then vanished from sight as dad then turned to you. "Tell me how you see this situation, my dear." Calmly, he said. "What does your heart and mind tell you?"

"What I see is you giving instruction to Josh Gary who was a part of the stand off earlier at school." Irritated, you replied. "Did you order him to try to sway Joe's decision?"

"I am the head mad scientist." Firmly, he said. "As such, all other mad scientists answer to me but I do not answer to you, young lady." He sighed. "You need to understand that the world you live in is far more complex than you can possibly imagine."

"What do you mean by that?" Taken back, you demanded.

"There are witches and mad scientists alike who are loyal to the old ways." Darkly, dad said. "The old ways of both powers are not compatible with each other so new ways had to be invented to prevent constant conflict that would have led to an inevitable war."

"So, you and mom are the only ones keeping the peace?" Gulping, you asked.

"Your mother and I created the new ways together which were, albeit reluctantly, agreed upon by both councils." Calmly, dad replied. "However, I am the last of my bloodline and I need a male heir to take my place or we risk everything falling apart if the new head mad scientist is loyal to the old ways."

"I- I had no idea..." Tearfully, you said.

Dad sighed. "If you have compassion, let me send no more to die." Gravely, he said, quoting a sad tune. "That is the cost of the crown."
152112133321312212121213324213222221112.title: The cost of the crown.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
After dad walked away, vanishing as he did, you ran to mom and reported what you saw and the conversation you had with him. "If Joe is the only heir..."

"Joe is not the only heir, Gina." Surprising you, mom said. "It may come as a shock to you but Tia is not as enthusiastic about magic as you may think."

"What?!" Taken back, you demanded. "Since when?! I have never meet a more feminine pair!"

Mom giggled. "You have never met a more masculine boy like Joe either." Bemused, she countered. "Tia had been following your father around since she was able to walk. The only reason she plays with magic is to get along with her sister, Ina."

"I never knew that." Wincing, you said. "Only how has she been following him around when he is so rarely here?"

"Your father usually keeps to his laboratory deep under the house, Gina." Softly, mom said. "Just because you can't see him does not mean he is not looking after you."

"Then why all the fuss over Joe?" Confused, you asked. "If Tia is so interested..."

"Tia is only seven and can still be easily swayed." Serious, mom said. "Do you really want her to fall under that kind of pressure?" She shook her head. "Joe is thirteen and he is barely dealing with it. He must have first choice because he was born a boy."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Joe is not the only heir.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
Deep underground, dad sighed as he looked out a large window overlooking a massive chamber that was buzzing with machines and robots. There was a deep scowl of concern on his face as images of mad scientists rallying for control of the throne flashed on screens built into the glass. "This is all going to end in war if I do not obtain a male heir before I am forced to step down." Darkly, he muttered. "Still, the law demands that I give Joe his fair choice."

Dad waved his hand, cancelling the images as he sensed a power source in the room then put on a smile as he turned around. "Greetings, my curious daughter." Patiently, he said. "What brings you to my office this day?"

Tia smiled, her face filled with excitement. "Daddy, I saw cellphone signals!" Beaming, she declared. "I could not listen in but I could see where they were going and they are everywhere!"

Dad raised a single eyebrow before placing a light hand onto Tia's head and ruffled it as he had many times before when she had some strange announcement. Before, dad merely dismissed it as a little girl trying to bond with her father. Only he sensed something different about Tia's power levels this time. "Hold perfectly still for me." Firmly but kindly, he said. "I want to see for myself what you had experienced."

Tia held as still as a seven year old could and dad looked directly into her eyes. With his power, he accessed her mind and was able to see what she she had seen within the past several hours. To his surprise and somewhat delight, he confirmed that Tia did indeed saw what she had claimed. Billions of blue and green strands of data streaming across the sky in all directions. As dad released Tia's mind, he moved his hand from the top of her head to her cheek in a loving manner. "You are experiencing what we chaotic scientists refer to as the supreme cerebrum awakening."

Tia's eyes danced with excitement and anticipation. "Does that mean I can work your chaotic science, Daddy?" Whispering, she asked.

Dad chuckled. "Let us first see if you transform on your own." Kindly, he said. "You have made your father very pleased and very proud."

Tia grabbed a hold of dad's hands, joyful tears running down her face. "Dad knelt down, smiling and pulled her into a gentle hug. "If you become a boy either you or Joe will become my heir."

Tia's celebration faltered slightly. "You mean if Joe doesn't want magic, he gets to be taught by you?" Looking hurt, she asked.

"He has the same right to choose as you do, my dear." Patiently, dad said. "Only he was born first so the choice is his to make first." Seeing Tia's frustration, he added, "If he chooses magic and you become a boy, you will be my soul heir to the throne."

Minutes later, Tia reappeared back inside her bedroom. "If Joe chooses magic, dad will spend more time with me, teaching me his science." Thoughtful, she muttered. "So all I have to do is get Joeanna to want to stay a girl."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Meanwhile with Tia and dad.

choices: They find you talking to Joe.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
Tia decided to go to her twins sister, Ina for help. The two were close only Tia fancied mad science more than magic. She loved what dad could do with his machines and gadgets as opposed to mom with her ordinary looking things and long winded spells. She found Ina in the sitting room, looking over a magic book she had borrowed from mom's library. They were really not allowed to do it but Ina figured mom would be too busy with you to notice until after she had returned it. "Hey, Ina." Smiling, Tia said. "Can we talk?"

Ina looked up from the book and sighed. "I guess." Calmly, she replied. "Mom's books are easier to read with the simplify spell but it takes away the potion ingredients and the wording of the spells." She shook her head. "What do you want to talk about?"

"Joeanna." Smiling, Tia replied. "It would be neat if she were to stay a girl. That way we each get an older sister."

"Maybe." Shrugging Ina agreed. She then smiled. "Or are you jealous Joe will get more of daddy's attention if he stays a boy?"

Tia blushed at that. "No..." Lamely, she said.

Ina giggled. "You went to daddy again, I know you did." Grinning, she said. "You always were daddy's little girl."

Tia turned red at that. For a witch to be called 'daddy's little girl' was like a mad scientist being called a 'mamma's boy'. "You take that back!" Tearfully, she threatened.

"Why should I?" Smugly, Ina demanded. "It's true. You want to be a boy so you can follow daddy around more." She huffed. "We are twins, we should both be witches forever and ever."

"I want to be like daddy!" Stomping one foot, Tia argued.

"Not if Joe hates magic." Smiling Ina replied.

With that,she vanished from sight. Fearing she would try to wreck her plans, Tia vnished to chase after her.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Twin Rivalry.

choices: she asked you both to leave the room.
she asked you both to stay.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
After having a word with dad and then mom, you moved on and told Joe what you had learned. Like you, she was not impressed. "I thought I said no more secrets." Irritated, she said.

"I just learned about this myself." Defensively, you replied. "I'm telling you because I don't want there to be any more secrets or surprises." You sighed. "Look, Tia wanting to be a mad scientist is both good and bad. It means there is less pressure on you."

"It also means there will be more pressure on Tia." Frowning, Joe said. "I doubt anyone of the witching world would be happy with her decision."

You shook your head. "No, not likely." Sighing, you said. You then decided to change the subject for the moment. "What do you think of magic so far? I know its only your third day but..."

"Magic is pretty cool." Smiling, Joe replied. "It's being a girl that I'm too sure about." She paused, biting her lip before adding, "I could have that time any day of this week experience."

You giggled, knowing what Joe was talking about. "It's not half as bad as you imagine." Bemused, you said. "Still, if it happens, we'll help you through it."

Joe was about to ask something when you both suddenly heard a pop just before Ina and Tia arrived arguing angrily with each other. They were both so upset, it seemed that you could not make out what they were saying though you could tell it was all about Joe.

"Stop this at once!" Igniting a flame, you ordered. "What has you two so worked up?!"

Ina and Tia stopped fighting then said in unison, "I want to talk to Joe."

They turned to each other, angry. "I said it first!" Annoyed, Tia claimed.

"No, I said it first!" Stomping one foot, Ina countered.

"Did not!"

"Did too!"

Joe turned from one girl to the other, not knowing what to do before turning to you. "I guess Ina found out what Tia wanted." Wincing, she said.

"I'm guessing that too." Sighing, you agreed.

You cancelled your flame as the two girls had fallen back into their heated argument, completely ignoring you and Joe for the moment. As they fought, you mentally called for mom with your magic and she appeared in the room. She shook her head at the spectacle then turned to you and Joe.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: They find you talking to Joe.

choices: Tia tries a more subtle approach.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
"I need you both to hear this." Firmly, mom said. "Stay here a moment." You and Joe nodded and mom shook the room yelling at Ina and Tia. "That's enough!"

Both girls stopped their argument and stood at attention in front of mom, startled. Mom shook her head, a look of disapproval on her face. "I have four days left to show Joe the wonders of magic." Irritated, she said. "Joeanna is already feeling a lot of pressure, I do not need either of you two adding to it!" She sighed. "Once this week is over and Joe has time to rest, your father will have a week to him the wonders of his chaotic science."

"Joeanna is better as a witch." Smiling, Tia said.

"No, you are better as a witch." Frowning, Ina countered.

"This is not a game!" Angry, mom boomed. "It is not for either of you to decide which power is best for Joe! That is for her, or him to decide!" She pointed a finger at the twins. "I am warning you two now... stay out of this!"

She then ushered you and Joe out of the room. "It's only going to get worse, mom." Wincing, you whispered. "Do you think they are close to a falling out?"

Mom sighed. "Tia's obsession has little to do with your father's science." Serious, she replied. "She has an Electra complex which means she is competing with me, with the entire family, for affections from your father."

"She's only seven." Wincing, you said. "Can't you or dad do something about it?"

"We could but we are hoping it is only a phase due to her young age." Frowning, mom replied. "If it gets too much worse, one of us will step in and correct the issue."

"Doesn't she have a crush or something?" Worried, you asked.

Mom shook her head. "Neither Ina or Tia have really discovered boys yet." Bemused, she replied. "I guess that is why Tia is so fixated on your father." She smiled. "Let us carry on with your lessons. As your father had said, the clock is ticking."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: she asked you both to stay.

choices: Thomas and Racheal discuss Ina and Tia.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
"Okay, Joe." Calmly, you said. "The next lesson will be in how to dodge spells."

"Didn't I show I could do that when I defended you in the last test?" Wincing, Joe asked.

"The energy blasts you could not stop, you allowed to hit you rather than let them through." Serious, mom countered. "You need to learn to dodge spells completely which requires fast maneuvers and even faster thinking."

Ina, who had followed you and mom spoke up. "Um... The Ironclads are having a training exercise in the school gymnasium tonight." Smiling, she said. "Joe can get a good idea how to dodge spells by watching it."

"The Amazons are having a training exercise there tonight too with a few Cauldron Academy teachers." Jumping in, Tia said. "Joe can see how girls dodge spells as well as boys."

"I thought I made it clear that you two were to stay out of this." Annoyed, mom said.

"We're trying to help." Ina and Tia said in unison.

"I wonder..." Frowning, you muttered.

"You're going to be there too, mom." Smiling, Tia said. "Joe should see you in action."

"Besides, Joe will only be watching." Serious, Ina pointed out. "Once she sees a few of the dodging techniques, she should be able to do them herself."

You frowned. "They have a valid argument though I question their motives." Whispering, you told mom. "What do you think?"

Mom sighed. "I am running out of time and there is still a lot to show her." Worried, mom replied. "We are still going to show Joe a few techniques but it wouldn't hurt if she watched the training session tonight."

Ina and Tia smiled before discretely throwing annoyed glares at each other. Mom shook her head, unimpressed. "Both of you, out." Firmly, she said. "We have a lot of work to do before the training exercises tonight."

Ina and Tia both left the room but went in different directions, making you curious only mom stopped you. "We don't have time to worry about them." Serious, she said. "Let's get to work."

While you and mom taught Joe how to dodge spells, Ina reached for her cellphone and dialed a number. "Joe is coming to the training exercise, Rachael." Quietly, she said. "Show her what girls can do."

"I'll give Joeanna a good show but I am not going to try to sway her one way or the other." Serious, Rachael replied. "It is against the code of ethics and not becoming of the heir to the throne of the Amazons."

In another part of the house, Tia phoned Thomas. "Joe is coming to the training exercise, Thomas." Quietly, she said. "Show 'him' what boys can do."

"I'll show Joeanna the skills and powers of a witch boy but I will do nothing to sway her decision one way or the other." Serious, Thomas replied. "It is against the ethics code and not becoming of the heir to the throne of the Ironclads."

"That is all I can ask." Ina and Tia responded. They ended their call at the same time.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Joe's lessons continue.

choices: You and Joe try to relax.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
Next door, in the house of Thomas Lore, Rachael turned to Thomas concerned. "What do you make of Ina and Tia's little feud over joe's gender?" Softly, she asked.

"Tia constantly craves attention." Calmly, Thomas replied. "From what I have been hearing from Joe, she follows their father everywhere with her teleportation skills."

"So its a case of jealousy." Bemused, Rachael said. "Tia doesn't want to share any of the attention she had been getting from her father."

Thomas nodded, a slight smirk on his face. "I doubt she fully understands the prerequisite of being a boy to learn chaotic science." Amused, he said. "I have no doubt it will come as a shock when it finally sinks in."

Rachael giggled then turned serious. "To be clear, we are not making any attempts to sway Joe either way. Our task is to inform young Ironclads and Amazons of their rights under witch and chaotic law."

"Our task by both parties is clear." Also serious, Thomas said. "We are to keep the peace between the two powers. Showing favor either way would be disastrous to our credibility as future leaders of our respective people."

The two shook hands.

Back at your house, Joe was doing well dodging and deflecting energy blasts and an occasional spell fired by you and mom at random. The two of you stopped when you noticed Joe was out of breath. "You did real good, sis." Smiling, you complimented. "You are quite the natural when it comes to magic."

"Thanks." Managing a smile, Joe said. "I still have to see what dad has to offer so you will forgive me if i don't celebrate just yet."

You nodded. "We understand."

"You have come a long way in just four days." Smiling, mom said. "I would love to teach you more but I can see you are exhausted." She sighed. "We will pick up your training tomorrow morning after breakfast."

"Isn't tomorrow a school day?" Curious, Joe asked.

"Parent/teacher conferences." Smiling, you replied. "There is no school so you get a long weekend to learn more magic."

"If you are not too tired, dad will start your training in chaotic science on Monday." Softly, mom added. "When that week comes to a close, it will be your choice where to continue."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Thomas and Racheal discuss Ina and Tia.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
That night, at the school, Witch and chaotic born people from the region gathered to take witness of an exercise of power between Ironclads and Amazons. Mom escorted you and Joe to the royal box with Ina and Tia. Dad sat on the opposite side of the gymnasium alone. "Why is daddy not sitting with us, mommy?" Wincing, Tia demanded.

"Your father is the head mad scientist." Calmly, mom explained. "Only he and his male heir may sit there while The royal witch family must sit here. If Joe was a boy, he would be over there with his father as his heir to the throne."

Unknown to Joe or Tia, they were both being tested. Dad had decades of rule before he would have to step down but he also had to choose his heir very carefully. You and mom knew of this test as you were tested in a similar way at Cauldron Academy. You had to announce yourself as the heir to the throne, being mom's daughter. Upon doing so, the other witch families reluctantly withdrew their bids for the throne,

"We should all be in one booth together." Softly, Joe said. "To show that we are united rather than divided despite our different powers."

"Well said, Joeanna." Appearing beside you, dad said. "The separate booths are merely a formality but I see no harm in sharing one booth to show unity."

"Have you given your report to the collective council?" Curious, mom asked.

Dad smiled. "I have informed the collective council that there are two viable candidates who would make fine heirs to the throne." Eying you and Tia, dad replied. "We are still weighing the options as both potential heirs are still rather young."

Mom grinned at that but nodded then turned her attention to the gymnasium as the exercises began with a short speech about Ironclads and Amazons.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: That night.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
"Witches are females who possess the cosmic power of magic." Serious, he began. "Many witch families have preferred their sons and brothers believe they did not posses this power unless they were transformed into the female state." He frowned. "This is a myth."

He then slammed his foot onto the floor, shaking the entire gymnasium. A number of young witches, including Ina and Tia screamed in fright. He then sent forth a powerful energy blast at the audience then lifted a number of heavy weights with his mind and threw them at the audience as well, causing even more frightened screams from the young witches. Fortunately, the blast wave and weights were stopped cold by the Soothsayers or witch police and Correction officers or mad science police. This left many young witches pale with fear as they turned to their brothers, uncertain. A few mothers had gulped with the same look of uncertainty on their faces.

"For a witch boy, all of his attributes and senses are off the scale by normal standards from the day they are born." Calmly, he explained. "As such, a witch boy must be trained at a very early age to control that raw physical power." He then frowned. "However, at such a young age, they cannot know of magic until they are much older and learn more restraint."

He then waved his mother forward who stood beside him. Mrs Trina Lore was a petite, doll like woman with long rosewood hair and green eyes. She stood a few inches shorter than her son. "Witch born boys learn to control their strength naturally." Serious, she said. "However, when pushed into a rage, their dormant magic sends those attributes into overdrive." She sighed. "There has been a growing number of cases where a witch boy has broken the limbs of their sister or mother after a magical prank or test that fell out of hand."

"There is also a growing number of cases where a witch boy's dormant magical power has taken root but is too physically powerful for the magic to shatter the fores that keep him male." Smiling, Thomas added. "That is where we come in! We teach witch boys to harness their natural skills to become the guardians of their witch family, the protectors of their secrets against the normal world!" He held his head up high with pride. "We are the Ironclads!"

A large number of witch boys stood up in applause with a few of their sisters and mothers joining them. You turned to Joe to see her applauding with the boys though not near as enthusiastically. She caught you looking and sighed. "I don't see myself as a body guard for mom or dad or even you or the twins." Shrugging, she said. Mom is an expert in combat magic, dad is the head mad scientist, you graduated at the top of your class and the twins have teleportation on their side."

"What do you see yourself as?" Curious, you asked.

Joe sighed, looking between mom and dad and you nodded in understanding. She was still felt trapped between wanting to make them both proud.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Thomas gives a speech.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
"Mommy, is his mom afraid of him?" Wincing, Ina asked, referring to Thomas.

Mom smiled. "Do not let her small size fool you, dear." Calmly, she said. "Mrs Lore is among the most powerful witches in our history. She and Thomas work together as strong advocates for the rights of all witch boys."

As Thomas walked back to the sidelines with his mother, Rachael Scott walked to the middle of the gymnasium while a number of girls quickly set up a number of props. You raised an eyebrow at the candles and clear containers, some empty and others filled with water. "Mad scientists, also known as chaotic scientists, are males with the elemental power of magic." Serious, she began. "Like witches, many prefer to have their daughters and sister believe that they have no real power unless they are transformed into the male state." She then grinned. "This is also a myth."

Many young witches and mad scientists alike braced themselves for a violent demonstration but were instead met with Rachael firing streams of fire from her fists and feet, elegantly lighting candles that were set up around her. She then fired water in the same manner, filling the empty containers before freezing them. She then produced wind in the same fashion, blowing out the candles before lifting it all and moving them aside with her mind. Finally, she tapped the floor, shaking the room slightly. This brought on a few startled yelps from the boys.

"Like witch boys, chaotic girls possess off the scale attributes as well as certain powers." Smiling, Rachael explained. "Many chaotic families have learned through painful experience that strong emotions augment these once thought dormant powers resulting in injury due to tests or pranks that have fallen out of control."

She then waved her father to her who complied with a grin. Mr. Grey T. Scott was a tall and thin with longish white hair and deep blue eyes. He politely cleared his throat before approaching the microphone. "Yes, well... chaotic girls possess the ability to manipulate one or two of the five elements of Earth to a limited degree." Calmly, he explained. "That said, they have the ability to not only hold their own but to level the playing field so to speak. Obviously, this requires training so to maintain the shroud of secrecy mad scientists work within."

"Like witch boys, chaotic girls have been known to find that their magical power had taken root but remained female due to their physical strength protecting the barrier that separates the genders." Smiling, Rachael added.

"When this occurs, these girls obtain the power to control all five elements of Earth." Cracking a grin, Grey said. "They become protectors of our secrets, guardians of our research, and so much more."

"We train young chaotic girls to control their powers so to have a say in their family, to have a place in the chaotic world." Proudly, Rachael said. "We are the Amazons!"

As before, a number of girls rose and cheered with a few boys and men joining them. You turned to Joe to again see her applauding but with the same lack of enthusiasm. Seeing your worried expression, dad smiled kindly. It was rare to see as he is usually always serious.

"Joe has many years to decide his path in life." Whispering carefully, he said. "Both leadership roles require the ability to deal well with great pressure and hard decisions, this is but a taste of what he or she as well as you will face later in life."

At that moment, it became more clear why mom and dad were acting the way they were. Joe was being tested before he was even really being trained. "Experience is the harshest of teachers." Sighing, you thought. "It tests first and teaches after."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Experience, the harshest of teachers.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
After Rachael had walked back to the sidelines, Thomas returned to the spotlight. "I ask that Princess Gina Mage join me for this next demonstration." Calmly, he said.

You blushed slightly as a spotlight fell upon you and mom urged you to stand up. Sighing, you complied and joined Thomas on the gymnasium floor. "What exactly do you require of me, Prince Thomas?" Politely, you demanded.

"You will be trying to change me into the female state while I try to advance." Serious, Thomas said. "My task is to tag you. The purpose of this is to show that the odds are more even than some witches and Ironclads like to think. the time limit is one minute."

You nodded and took a defensive position while Thomas stood several feet away, taking the same stance before beginning his advance. He began by shaking the floor in an attempt to throw you off balance. Only you trained for that and managed to remain steady. You fired spells, fully intending to win as losing, in your mind, would certainly cause a loss of face with your fellow witches. Only, despite your efforts, Thomas was able to dodge or deflect every spell and even threw a few right back at you.

"Okay, I need to limit my spells to those he can't throw back." Calmly, you thought. "Otherwise, he can distract me to get closer."

Despite your efforts, you were unable to hit Thomas but he was unable to get close enough to to tag you. A buzzer sounded marking the end of the minute and you both stopped before bowing to each other. "As you can see, unless one catches the other off guard, the odds are fairly even." Firmly, Thomas said. "Once a witch boy is effected by magic, he can see it coming and dodge it with his natural physical skills." He then smiled. "However, a witch has the power to easily dodge any blow a witch boy can muster with their magic."

"That and there is a safeguard in all witch households." Calmly, you added. "Any combination of witch, witch boy or Ironclad who gets into a magical fight will find themselves three year olds with no power to change back until another witch restores them."

Thomas nodded. "The same safeguard exists in all chaotic households." Serious, he said. "Any combination of chaotic scientist, chaotic girl, or Amazon who gets into a magical fight will find themselves in the same situation." He then turned to you. "Thank you, Princess Gina for helping me with this demonstration."

"It was my pleasure, Prince Thomas." Politely, you replied.

With that, you returned to your seat where mom waited with a bemused smile on her face. "Well done, Gina." Softly, she said. "You did not hold back. Had you did, it would have raised suspicions of favoritism."

You blushed at that knowing everyone suspected you and Thomas had a crush on each other. "We're just friends." Lamely, you said.

Mom smiled while dad expertly hid a smile of his own. "We can discuss this later." Calmly, he said. "The next demonstration is about to begin."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: The demonstration begins.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
Upon returning home late that night, everyone was in good spirits though Joe seemed lost in thought. "Magic is a cosmic power as it gains its power from the cosmos." Thinking out loud, she muttered. "Chaotic science is an elemental power as it gains its power from all the Earths in the cosmos."

"More precisely, every living planet in the cosmos." Calmly, dad explained. "Humans can not live everywhere though life does exist."

"The origins of each power have been debated for centuries." Bemused, mom said. "Try not to think too much about it."

"All you need to understand is that Witchcraft is a magic geared for girls and Chaotic science is a magic geared for boys." Smiling, you said. "Because you have a witch mother and mad science father, you can go either way."

"So could you..." Frowning, Joe countered.

"Gina went through this during her year at Cauldron Academy." Serious, dad said. "It was highly stressful for her so we decided on a different approach with you."

"The pressure put upon me by the witch professors and the visiting mad science professors drove me crazy." Tears forming, you explained. "I was not allowed to talk about it as it could have been seen as trying to sway your decision."

"I see..." Wincing, Joe said. She turned to mom. "What's next in my training?"

"We will pick up where we left off tomorrow morning." Sighing, mom said. "I think we all could use a little rest."

With that, we all retired to our bedrooms.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Returning home.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
That night, while you tried to sleep, you sensed someone had magically appeared in your room and instantly cued the lights. A yep reached your ears and you confronted a teenage girl you had seen around school. Her name was Abby Cane. She was about a year younger than you with shoulder length red hair and deep green eyes. She wore the Cauldron Academy uniform with a cloak too big for her covering it. You guessed she had borrowed it from her mother. Abby was a well known trouble witch, she enjoyed playing pranks on normal teenage boys, seducing them into doing all sorts of crazy things for nothing more than her own twisted amusement.

"You have less than a minute before my mother, or worse, father detects your presence and takes proper action, Cane." Darkly, you said.

"Your mother and father are busy dealing with my two new little friends who are right now visiting your temporary sister, Joeanna and your little sisters, Ina and Tia." Grinning, Abby countered. "Normal boys are annoying but they are at least useful as a few minute distraction."

"What do you want, Cane?" Ice in your voice, you demanded. "It's one in the morning."

"I want to know if you are really willing to step down as heir to the throne." Grinning, Abby said. "You know there are many witches who frown upon a transformed boy becoming head witch."

"This is only if her transformation is forced." Unimpressed, you said. "The choice must be hers or his as it was mine."

"There are many mad scientists who would see that transformation forced to gain a foot hold in their campaign to take your father's throne." Frowning, Abby said. "You need to think about what is right for your own kind."

"My own kind..." Annoyed, you asked. "What do you mean by that?"

"You are Joe's older sister." Grinning, Abby said. "He listens to you. That said, if he takes the chaotic throne, the witching world can take back what is rightfully theirs."

"I think I know where this is going." Becoming angered, you said.

"I'm running out of time." Stepping back to the window, Abby said. "Think about this, you know I am right. Your brother is the key to making us rulers of this world again."

With that, she was gone just as mom rushed into the room with a look of concern. "We caught two love sick normal boys climbing into Joeanna and Ina's bedrooms." Worried, she said. "We dispatched them through use of the local authorities. Have you received any such visit?"

You shook your head. "Those boys were pawns." Frowning, you replied. "Abby Cane used them to distract you and dad so she could talk to me."

"Relay your conversation so we may take appropriate action." Firmly, dad demanded.

You told mom and dad what Abby had said to which both frowned. "Such outdated, obsolete thinking." Shaking his head, dad muttered. "I will post a report of her rhetoric to the Failure Oversight Department."

"Thank you for telling us, Gina." Softly, mom said. "The Cane family is well known for stirring up trouble. I will inform the Department of Dark Magic Control. of her actions so she can be more closely watched."

"Do you think Abby or someone else might try to change Joe for their own political gain?" Wincing, you asked. "Have they tried that with me?"

"Sadly, yes." To your horror, dad replied. "Technically, you are still at risk until the crowning ceremony."

"Don't worry about it too much, dear." Forcing a smile, mom said. "Try to get some sleep, we will discuss it further in the morning."

They then left the room with you filled with more worry than before.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: That night.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
You had assumed, when you made your choice to be a witch, you were safe from anyone trying to sway your decision. Now you knew that you were not in the clear until after your crowning ceremony. You could only guess that it was mom's efforts that were keeping anyone from approaching you after you had graduated. "Dad said that this was a test to determine who gets the throne." Worried, you whispered. "I wonder if Tia was influenced to be a part of the test on Joe."

"Partially." Startling you, a familiar voice said. You cued the lights as before but they did not respond. the voice chuckled. "I'm afraid that, because that arrogant Abbagale beat me here, I had to take certain precautions."

Recognizing the voice as your thirteen year old cousin, Henry, you sighed. "What do you want, Henry?"

Henry, as you remembered, was short for his age with longish blond hair and blue eyes. He summoned a pyrokinetic flame to his hand so you could see his face. "Just to inform you that I have decided to become a magic scientist." Surprising you, he said. "As such, I can claim my status as a mad scientist while embracing my mother's magic."

A magic scientist was a boy of chaotic blood who was an expert in the functions and workings of magic. It was a relatively new position as there were also mad science sorceresses who were girls of witch blood who were experts in the functions and workings of chaotic science. "Dare i ask why you are telling me this so early in the morning?" Darkly curious, I asked.

"Only because I leave for my training in a few short hours." Serious, Henry replied. "Also because it is an option your transformed brother can follow. He can become the heir to the chaotic throne and an expert in the ins and outs of magic."

"You know I cannot influence her or his decision." Sighing, you said.

"No but you can offer him or her options to consider." Smiling, Henry countered. "You know your transformed brother is conflicted. Do something about it."

With that, he vanished as quickly as he had came and the lights responded to your cue and came on. "I need a better security system." Shaking your head, you muttered.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: You can't sleep.

choices: Tia learns you can work mad science.
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
The following morning, you began to walk down to breakfast to find Joe, a boy again, sleepily walking out of his room. "Morning..." In a slur, he said.

"When did you change back?" Curious, you asked.

Joe shrugged. "In my sleep, I guess." Tiredly, he replied. "Or maybe that idiot who climbed the tree to my window made me mad enough to shake off the spells." He grunted. "He has no idea the number of procedures, processes, and all around red tape he had forced into motion!"

Your jaw dropped. "You almost sound like dad..." Whispering, you said.

Joe yawned. "Whatever." Uninterested, he said. "I'm dying for a shower. I smell like a rolled in a field of flowers."

You giggled at that then walked down to find mom and dad talking quietly at the dinning room table. They stopped talking upon taking notice of you."

"Father, we had four intrusions upon this household in under an hour last evening." Serious, you said. "I can only deduce that either someone had allowed this to occur or our security system is obsolete and requires updating." You winced. "there is one other thing..."

"The security system was tampered with from the outside." Calmly, dad interrupted. "Both your mother and I detected magic so we came to the conclusion that it was Abbagale Cane who was responsible." He cracked a grin. "Fear not, I have installed a security system of my own, this oversight shall not be repeated."

"We were discussing our options as to how to react to Abby's intrusion." Serious, mom added. "Henry was reprimanded for his intrusion and a former letter of apology has been ordered." She sighed. "However, the Canes although known for trouble are a powerful family with influence within the witch council."

Hearing that, you grinned, gaining both mom and dad's attention and curiosity. "I believe this can be resolved with a simple visit to Abby's mother." Smiling, you said. "She values her reputation more than most. If Abby did indeed break witch and chaotic law to come visit me, it could tarnish that reputation." Before your parents would respond, you quickly added. "However, if we were to graciously allow the incident to slide without it reaching the ears of either council..."

"She would owe us a debt of honor." Smiling, dad finished. "Deviously clever, my dear spell weaving daughter."

"She would want to pay that debt as quickly as possible to avoid any uncomfortable questions as the debt will partially be owed to a mad scientist." Thoughtful mom said. "Do you have any ideas regarding that?"

You nodded. "Joe is nearly halfway through the process of making a decision." Calmly, you said. "He has no interest in being an Ironclad or an Amazon and her ability to work magic has eliminated the possibility of him or her wishing to be normal."

"Granted." Nodding, dad said. "Only how will this knowledge allow Ms Cane to pay her debt to this family?" Curious, dad asked.

You winced. "Well, you recall I tried to say there was one other thing."

As if on cue, Joe entered the room with a grumpy expression. "Those paradoxical, obstinate, irksome, tempestuous, preadolescent nincompoops of my little sisters are hogging both bathrooms again!" Irritable, he said. "I need a hot, relaxing cup of herbal tea to steady my nerves."

Mom's jaw dropped as dad gave a goofy overjoyed grin. "Joe has an equally strong talent for mad science." Softly, you said. You summoned a glowing, sparking sphere to your right hand that hovered and sparkled. "The same talent I have."

Again dad nodded. "I knew of this but it still does not answer the question." Patiently, he said. "How will Gretchen Cane pay her debt of honor?"

"It should be obvious, dad." Irritable, you snapped. "It's a coin toss. Joe and I will take the thrones. The only question is, which throne will we take?"

"She could spread the word, easing tensions from those yearning to seize the thrones on both sides." Serious, mom said. She sighed. "Only it raises another issue..."

Dad frowned, a sigh escaping his own lips. "Neither Joe or Gina are bonded with a boyfriend and girlfriend."

This stunned you. "You don't mean..."

Mom nodded. "Expect love letters to arrive soon, dear." Serious, she said. "Those who marry into the royal family on either side will gain great influence."
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: Mounting complications.

1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.content:
"How much time do we have?" Gulping, you asked.

"Once we finish talking to Gretchen Cane, word will spread like wild fire through both communities." Serious, dad said. "If you truly have feelings for Thomas Lore, the prince of the ironclads, I suggest you accept him as your boyfriend."

"The same goes for you, young man." Bemused, mom said. "Though I would wash off the makeup and perfume scent first."

Joe blushed at that. "It all comes with the territory of learning magic." Yawning, he said. "I will approach Rachael Scott after breakfast."

Mom nodded, satisfied then sighed as she turned back to you. "Fortunately, you had already received some mad science training during your year at Cauldron Academy." Softly, she said. "There will be no need to repeat that experience."

You nodded before summoning your spark, as mad scientists called it, to your right hand. Joe smiled and did the same; his was slightly larger due to him being male. Only, just as you were about to cancel your own spark, you heard a gasp from behind and turned to find Tia looking at you and Joe with her jaw dropped. "You can work mad science too!?" Distraught, she demanded.

"Of course." Smiling, dad said. "All of my children are capable of this."

Tia's lips trembled as her body shook. You felt a twinge of pity for her as you knew how much she wanted dad's attention. "But... I want to be the mad scientist..." Crying, Tia whined. "Joe is supposed to be a witch." She turned to Joe angrily. "You are supposed to be a witch!"

She then ran off, crying as mom sighed and dad merely shook his head. "I should talk to her." Muttering, you said. "She doen't understand..."

"Leave her." Serious, dad said. "This is more your mother's expertise."

Mom nodded. "I too wanted all of my father's attention when I was around her age." Ruefully, she said. "I know more of what she is going through."

"You and I have a different mission to accomplish." Serious, dad said.

"Can it wait until after we eat?" Grumpily, Joe asked.

Dad chuckled. "Once we have had our morning meal, we must...
1521121333213122121212133242132222211122.title: The green eyed monster.

153.content:
You decided to talk to the mad scientist recruiter, Josh Gary first. You knew first hand how aggressive he could be when trying to convince anyone, boy or girl to sign up for Eliete Scientiam all boys mad science academy. If it were not for the Soothsayers or witch police, you feared you might have been dragged to the school against your will for a tour. You knew where he kept his office and teleported yourself there where you found him at his desk, working through a small stack of papers in front of him.

"Ah, princess Gina Mage." Nodding at you, he said. "I will be with you momentarily."

He continued to work on the papers for what seemed like an eternity before slowly rising from his chair ans cricking his back. "I see you have graduated from Cauldron Academy, judging from your magical aura." Bluntly, he said. "What can I do for you?"

"My brother Joe is missing." Flatly, you replied. "Perhaps you know something about this."

"I am aware that your bother is missing." Frowning, Josh said. "The Correction Officers from the Failure Oversight Department have already visited me, demanding a statement."

"You don't know where he is?" Pale, you demanded.

Josh shook his head. "I will tell you what I told the Correction officers." Calmly, he said. "The last time I saw prince Joe Mage was at school today. He was with..."
153.title: talk to Josh Gary.

154.content:
You decided to search Joe's room for clues as it was not like him to not return home from school without any call or note. You entered his room and found a sizeable stack of open letters on his work desk. Sensing both magic and chaotic energies, you cautiously picked one up and found it to be an advertisement to a gymnastics tryout at the school. "That would certainly lead Joe to investigate further." Frowning, you said. "Only why would he not say anything to mom?"

You picked up another letter, which you sensed magic, and found it to be a new salon for boys that had just opened in the new mini mall a few blocks away. "Joe had been searching for ways to unwind before I left." Musing, you said. "He might have gone there." You frowned. "Only, again, why not tell mom?"

Then, you noticed that the letters were limited time offers and realized that Joe would not have the time to convince mom to allow him to go to either one. "I'd better investigate these just in case." Worried, you said. "Only which one do I check first?"
154.title: Junk mail campaign.

choices: wearing a lab coat, grinning madly.
1543.content:
Before you could make a decision, your cellphone rang. Seeing it was Joe on the caller ID, you quickly answered. "Joe, where are you?!" Irritated, you snapped. "You had us worried sick!"

"Gina, I need you to meet my by the lone tree in the forest on the hill." Quickly, Joe replied. "Thomas has gotten himself into a real mess." There was a pause before he added, "I'm scared for him."

You gasped, worried about both your brother and your friend. "I'll be there as quick as I can, Joe." Firmly, you said. "I'll bring mom."

"Come alone, sis!" Startling you, Joe snapped. "Mom will freak if she finds out what Thomas has been meddling with!"

You sighed. "Okay." Wearily, you replied. "I have to at least tell her I found you."

"Fine." Quickly, Joe said. "Just get here as quick as you can!"

With that, Joe ended the call and you ran down to mom who saw the urgency on your face. "Did you find Joe?" Hopeful, she demanded.

"Joe called me." Worried, you said. "Apparently, Thomas got himself into serious trouble through meddling with something he shouldn't. Joe asked me to come alone."

Mom nodded. "Joe and Thomas were always like brothers." Softly, she said. "If you need me, just touch your necklace."

You nodded back, knowing that the necklace mom referred to was a magical emergency call signal which would tell mom exactly where you were so she could teleport to your position. "Don't worry, mom; I'll let you know if it's serious."

With that, you cast the proper spell and appeared behind Joe and Thomas. "I'm here, bro." Forcing yourself to pant, you said. "What kind of trouble is Thomas in?"

"See for yourself." Frowning, Joe replied.

Curious, you walked up then sighed as you found that Thomas was...
1543.title: Joe calls you.

choices: I shall deal with this immediately!
Your mother has it under control.
You must learn to deal with your own issues.
I don't have time for this.
15433.content:
You sighed seeing Thomas sitting against the tree in a sort of a daze, babbling like a complete drunken idiot. "How long as he been like this?" Suspecting magic, you asked.

"Ever since I met him after school." Frowning, Joe replied. "The principal asked me to take a letter to Lydia Rune at her student council meeting but she also wanted to talk to me."

You again sighed, shaking your head. "I'm guessing Thomas offered to take it for you." Softly, you said. "What did the principal want with you?"

"Something about not trusting the new gym and salon in the mall." Shrugging, Joe replied. "She told me that she had heard a lot of complaints about both places and seemed to know just how crazy protective dad was of us."

You nodded then turned to Thomas. "Poor guy must have been hit with an incoherence spell." Shaking your head, you thought. "It's easy to fix but why did Lydia cast it on him? He knows nothing about magic. Also, what's with the lump on the back of his head? Did someone hit him... It doesn't make sense."

Deciding to play it safe, for now, you placed a hand onto his head as if you examine him and cast the proper spell to cancel the magical effect on him. Thomas fell limp for a moment then shook his head before looking at you. "That... was... weird." Stammering, he muttered. "I... feel.... like..."

"Don't try to talk right now." Serious, you said. "You took a blow to the head."

"What?!" Startled, Joe demanded. "I didn't notice any..."

He paused as you showed him a lump on the back of Thomas' head. "It looks like someone blindsided him, bro." Softly, you said. "A good whack on the head will make anyone talk in a drunken stupor for a while."

Joe grunted, angry that his friend had been hurt. "I'll find out who did this." Through gritted teeth, he hissed. "Someone just messed with the wrong family."

"Let mom and dad handle this one, Joe." Serious, you warned. "Revenge is a fool's game."

"Do you think I was being set up?" Worried, Joe asked.

You shook your head. "If that was the case, the principal would not have allowed Thomas to deliver the letter." Softly, you replied. "I'm thinking Thomas walked in on something he shouldn't and got knocked out cold before he saw too much."

With that said, you helped Joe take Thomas home then escorted him home where mom was waiting with dad standing behind her. "Was it anything serious?" Wincing, mom asked.

You were about to answer only Joe cut in. "Dad, there's something weird going on at school and I'm afraid Thomas got clobbered upon stumbling upon it." Serious, he said. "He took a letter to Lydia Rune I was asked to take by the principal because she also wanted to talk to me."

Dad grunted then replied...
15433.title: constantly babbling nonsense.

154331.content:
Dad retrieved a cellphone from his vest pocket and dialed a number. He did not have long to wait as a male voice answered though you could not hear what he was saying. "There was a minor failure of safety and control at Windward school in my district." Firmly, almost aggressively, he said.
