15433112324.content:
Before Joe could pull out a single article of clothing, you used your magic to pull him out of arm's reach of his closet or dresser. "hey!" Annoyed, Joe shouted. "What are you doing?!"

"Saving you from your own impatience." Frowning, you replied. "Mom said not to touch anything until she got back. What makes you think you know more than an expert in combat magic?"

"I was playing a hunch, a gut instinct." Blushing, Joe argued.

"One that could have left you my little sister rather than my little brother." Irritated, you fired back. "Let those who know a little more about these things to handle this."

Joe sighed. "I like to solve my own problems."

"This one is over your head." More softly, you said. "Besides, I feel this is an attack on me, using you to get to me as you are not yet resistant to magic."

"What do we do then?" Wincing, Joe demanded.

"For now, I suggest we all get out of here and stay out of here until the puzzle can be cracked." Serious, you said. "This is not over, Joe; its just the beginning."

Joe sighed then quickly backed towards the door, looking startled. You turned to the closet then gasped. "Joe, run!"
15433112324.title: you intervene

155.content:
Just as you were about to decide where to look, your cellphone rang. It was your grandmother and head with, Ella Mist. "I apologize for calling you after just arriving home, my dear." Calmly, she said. "However, we have a rather bemusing situation at Cauldron Academy which we feel you and your mother should be made aware of."

You sighed. "Let me guess." Softly, you said. "Joe is there."

Ella giggled kindly. "He arrived here on a rather crudely built mechanical broomstick." Bemused, she said. "Apparently, he was looking for you."

You found yourself trapped between laughing at the fact Joe was at Cauldron Academy, likely a female student, and worrying at the fact he managed to build a mad science equivalent to a witch's broomstick. You turned to mom. "Joe is at Cauldron Academy, he somehow built a mechanical broomstick and flew there."

Mom winced. "Has 'she' been enrolled?"

You asked mom's question to which Ella replied. "Not as of yet. Joe at least had the sense to land, or rather, crash outside of school grounds." She giggled. "Unless we enroll 'her' Joe will need transport home as his crude flying machine has been destroyed in his crash landing."

You sighed, rolling your eyes then turned to mom, giving her the message. Mom too seemed trapped between laughter and worry.
155.title: Joe learns the truth early.

1553.content:
Unknown to anyone, Joe had found a secret room in the basement shortly after you had left for Cauldron Academy. Inside, he found wonders beyond his wildest dreams. Dad had spoken to him about it shortly after finding it.

"I am a chaotic scientist, my son." Serious, he said. "It is a step above and beyond what people may view as magic. With this laboratory I had lovingly built for you, I have decided it was time for you to discover and explore your new found powers."

"Maybe, I should tell mom." Uncertain, Joe had said.

Dad smiled kindly, uncharacteristic of him. "You let me worry about your mother." Softly, he said. "Allow yourself some indulgence and explore our legacy."

At first, Joe was uncertain and unnerved but something about the laboratory called to him and he began to explore. Little did he know the addictive properties of chaotic science and soon found himself less and less concerned about telling mom of his discovery and of him learning chaotic science unsupervised. Still, his concern for you, his missing sister grew and grew. Finally, he had built his first mechanical broomstick and was determined to find you. With a hint dropped by dad, Joe discovered you were at Cauldron Academy and flew over the school a mere hour after you had left in a school van for home.

The school looked fairly normal from the air, just a complex of dark low buildings surrounded by a high vine covered wall. Joe circled the complex from above, becoming more and more worried. "I am sensing a lot of power down there." Wincing, he muttered. "How am I going to find Gina's bio signal with all that interference?"

Suddenly, an alarm sounded on the broomstick controls and Joe looked up to see a number of teenage girls quickly approaching him on broomsticks he could only guessed were versions of his own! "Uh-oh!"

Joe dived, taking evasive action while still searching for your bio signature, not knowing you had already left. The four teenage girls gave chase all around campus. "What did I do?! What did I do?!" Frightened, he screamed. "I'm just looking for my sister! Go away!"

"You are invading witch controlled airspace!" Sternly, a woman's voice sounded in his head. "Leave the area immediately or be forced down!"

"Where is my sister?!" Still evading, Joe demanded in his own thoughts. "I know she was sent here!"

Although Joe did not know how, his thought reply was received and the answer came. "All those who came here have graduated and left for home. I suggest you do the same, young man." There was a pause before the woman then yelled, "Look out!"

Joe turned just in time to run flat into the parameter wall. The broomstick was destroyed and Joe was thrown over the wall outside of school property. Joe laid, stunned on the grassy ground, his ears ringing and his head spinning, as the four teenage girls stepped up to him. As they looked upon his face, a bemused look formed upon their faces. "Joe Mage." Shaking her head, one said. "His mother is going to be furious..."
1553.title: Hours earlier, Joe's flight.

choices: You and mom take Joe home.
15531.content:
When you and mom arrived at Cauldron Academy, Joe was being treated for minor injuries due to his fall from the eight foot wall after his crash. He was blushing brightly, no doubt from the attention he was getting. With him was your grandmother and head witch, Ella Mist. Joe's glum expression turned to depression upon seeing mom approach with a cross look on her face. You were not very impressed either but you nor mom were really mad at Joe. Your anger was with dad.

"Your son managed to build his mechanical broomstick out of obsolete gadgetry." Bemused, Ella said. "I must say it was an impressive build since no witch had ever managed to build a broomstick out of magical artifacts."

"That's because its foolish and dangerous." Eying Joe, mom said. "Just wait until I get a hold of your father! He should know better than to keep his artifacts locked up!"

Joe winced. "Actually, I made in a lab dad gave me." Timidly, he admitted. "I wanted to tell you but dad said to let him worry about you."

Mom turned red, becoming even angrier. "He WHAT?!" Furious, she demanded.

"Neither Joe's spark or flame has ignited yet." Frowning, Ella said. "Joe did this all through his dormant magical power using mad science equipment and artifacts."

"That's even worse!" Her rage climbing, mom screamed. "That means his father was experimenting on him to see what he can do given the tools of mad science!" She fumed, becoming angrier. "I might as well let him stroll around in my potion closet and tell him its a spice rack!"

Joe whimpered, holding his arms up as if to protect himself. "I didn't do anything wrong... I just wanted to find Gina..."

"Easy, Mona." Scolding, Ella whispered. "Your son is still unaware, you are terrifying him with your rant."

Mom sighed, turning to you. "Get him into the car." Sternly, she said. "We will deal with this at home." She then more softly added, "He is a victim of your father's obsession to experiment; treat him as such."

You nodded then gently helped Joe to his feet before walking him to the car. "It's going to be okay, Joe." Soothingly, you said. "We'll have a nice long talk about this at home."

Joe was shaking and whimpering at this point causing you to wince. "You poor kid." Shaking your head, you thought. "I can only imagine how scared and confused you are right now."
15531.title: You and mom arrive furious.

155312.content:
The ride home was quiet and unpleasant. Mom was becoming dangerously furious trying to get a hold of dad on her cellphone while you did your best to calm an increasingly distressed brother because of it. "His dormant magic is like a shield." Frowning, you thought. "Unless he can calm himself down, he risks it activating, making him a girl for life and a witch."

"Mom is not really mad at you, bro." Trying to be comforting, you said. "It's dad she's angry with..."

"I should have told her." Whimpering, Joe said. "I- I just got so caught up in it..." He shook his head, terrified. "I should have told her..."

You sighed seeing Joe's left hand glowing slightly. "You need to calm down, Joe." Serious, you said. "I told you, mom and I are not that mad at you."

Upon reaching home, mom gave up trying to get a hold of dad and turned to Joe. "Where is this lab?" Forcefully, she demanded.

Shaking, Joe lead you and mom to the basement where he pointed to a narrow door between the washer and drier. Mom opened the door and peered in before stepping back with a long thin rod in hand. "This is for your own good, Joe." Firmly, she said.

before Joe could utter a word of protest, mom fired a light from the rod and you heard an explosion before the door vanished as if it were never there. You winced as all the color drained from Joe's face. "Dad gave that to me!" Distraught, he screamed. "What did you do?!"

Rather than answering, mom caused the wooden rod to vanish and turned to you. "Take him to his room." Her voice quivering, she said. "I am too annoyed to council him at the moment."

If Joe wasn't distressed before, he certainly was then. He screamed then...
155312.title: You and mom take Joe home.

choices: made herself tea to calm down.
1553121.content:
Joe ran from the house, wailing in tears. You ran after him onto to find that dad was out on the front lawn, seemingly waiting for him. He caught Joe by the hand and pulled him into a warm embrace. "Joe... What troubles you?!" With sham concern, he demanded. "Talk to your father!"

Joe returned dad's embrace, crying like a small child as he tearfully explained his flight over Cauldron Academy, mom's angered reaction and her destroying his lab. Mom and I watched as dad rocked Joe back and forth, cooing him. "There, there, Joseph." Cooing, Joe, he said. "Laboratories can be rebuilt. Don't concern yourself with your mother or older sister's jealousy of your power."

Both yours and mom's jaw dropped as dad then flashed us both a discrete evil grin Joe did not see. "We played right into his hands!" Furious, mom whispered. "Your father has managed to make me the bad witch!"

You sighed, knowing you had to say or do something before a full on fight broke out between mom and dad with you and Joe in the middle. "The lab, as you call it, was only a workstation with obsolete gadgetry." Stepping forward, you said. "No scientist, chaotic or not, should toy with them without first the proper training."

"You willingly placed our son in danger, Geo!" Angrily, mom said. "Now, you coo him as if I'm the bad witch?!"

"Joe cannot hear you at this time, my dear beloved wife and daughter." Grinning, dad said. "I was forced to sedate him so his dormant magical power would not activate."

"Why are you doing this?!" Shaking, mom demanded.

Dad laughed maniacally, causing you to shudder. "Come now, you know I can read witch writing, Mona." Smiling, he said. "I know you were planning to tempt Joe with magic the instant Gina returned from Cauldron Academy. A preemptive strike was necessary to show my son the proper path in life."

"You son of a...!" Charging, mom screamed.

Dad laughed as he vanished, taking Joe with him...

Mom screamed in frustration then stormed back into the house where she...
1553121.title: Dad's dasterdly plan.

choices: Elle talks to you about the test.
15531212.content:
Mom immediately phoned the head witch, too angry and distraught to notice that Ina and Tia were watching from the other room, frightened and confused. You winced, seeing them and quickly cast a sleep spell before taking them both to bed. "It's better you two think it was a nightmare." Sadly, you thought. "It wouldn't be too far from the truth."

By the time you returned, mom got off the phone with the head witch and turned to you. There was a sense of relief but also frustration on her face, confusing you. "Good news or bad news?" Wincing, you asked.

"Both." Frowning, mom said. "This is a witch test!"

"What?!" Startled, you demanded. "On who?!"

Mom fumed. "On your father and its being run by my mother, the head witch!" Annoyed, she snapped. "Elle planted my witch writing on the calendar to see what Geo would do to protect his legacy." She huffed, shaking her head. "No wonder she was so bemused by it all rather than annoyed."

"What are we going to do?" Wincing, you asked.

"I am not going to allow anything, let alone some test tear the fabric of this family apart!" Hissing, she said. "I need to get to Geo and let him know the truth."

"I hope he believes you." Worried, you said.

"I hope so too, honey." Serious, mom replied. "Otherwise, it may not end well for any of us and that includes the head witch."

Later on...
15531212.title: A test on your father.

choices: I need to do this alone.
Ina and Tia teleport into your room.
1553122.content:
Joe up the stairs, wailing in tears. He nearly ran over Ina and Tia in his haste to get to his room before slamming the door to the point of shaking the windows. You gave chase and winced seeing Ina and Tia jumping out of the way with a low scream. Mom followed shortly after, still furious.

"Your father had Joe toying with things he scarcely understood." Her voice strained, she said. "I did what was best for him."

"I know, mom." Wincing, you said. "Still, Joe doesn't."

Mom sighed, a pained look on her face. "Please talk to him." Wearily, she demanded. "I need to deal with your father."

You slowly nodded and walked to Joe's room only you stopped to check on Ina and Tia who were visually shaken. "Is Joe okay?" Wincing, Ina asked.

"Did something happen?" Worried, Tia asked.

"Dad gave him something mom believes is bad for him and she took it away." Gently, you explained. "Joe is taking it badly, I have to talk to him."

Ina and Tia turned to each other, worried then nodded before turning to you. "We want to help." Firmly, they said in unison. "He's our brother too."

You smiled, knowing that your little sisters despite their bratty nature genuinely wanted to help you when you needed it. "Thanks, girls." Smiling, you said. "But..."
1553122.title: ran to his room.

15531222.content:
Ina and Tia pouted at that rule. "A calming spell will..." Tia began.

"Joe is very hurt and confused." Serious, you interrupted. "I saw his left hand glow on the way home. Any spell could send him over the edge, making him a girl and a witch against his will."

"What's so bad about being a girl?" Shrugging, Ina asked.

"What's so bad about being a boy?" Calmly, you countered.

Ina sighed. "Okay... no magic but what can we do?"

"Just let me do the talking." Returning to your feet, you said. "If things get out of hand, get out of his room fast."

Ina and Tia nodded though you suspected they did not know how dangerous a distraught witch boy can be. You knew it was a risk bringing them along but you were hoping their presence would move Joe to control his anger more than if it were just you. Ina knocked, uncertain then called out, "Joe... are you okay in there?"

"Oh, I'm just perfect!" Sarcastically, Joe called back. "Never better!"

Ina sighed then opened the door only you stepped in first, keeping her behind you. "We need to talk, Joe." Softly, you said. "Mom didn't destroy your little lab, she sealed it until she could talk to dad."

"Dad still gave it to me." Pouting, Joe argued. "It's rare that he gives anyone anything so it means a lot to me."

"The fact he rarely gives anything to anyone should be your first red flag, Joe." Serious, you said. "Dad deals in very dangerous things. What he gave you was mild comparatively but still dangerous."

"You talk as if you know a lot more than you are letting on." Frowning, Joe said. "Also what was with mom's rant earlier? What did she mean by a potion closet?"

You sighed. "That is actually what I need to talk to you about."
15531222.title: No magic, just talk.

choices: Mom talks or rather argues with dad
155312221.content:
You took a breath. "I'm a witch, Joe. In fact, all of the girls in this family are witches with the power to work magic. Sorry but only girls can work magic."

"So what was I using..." Wincing, Joe asked. "I thought is was some kind of wizardry."

You smiled at that. "Dad and all the males related to him are chaotic scientists with a power of magic that works for boys only they do not see it as magic." You then imitated dad, adding, "Magic is such an outdated term..."

Joe chuckled, seeing your humor. "Then I was using this mad science." Softly, he said. "Why was mom so angry then?"

"Because you really cannot work magic or mad science until your flame, for magic, or spark, for mad science, ignites." Serious, you explained. "Dad had you toying with the tools and old relics of mad science." You sighed. "I'm guessing it was to cause your spark to ignite early."

"Then how was I able to fly a broom?" Worried, Joe asked.

"That's a good question." Wincing, you said. "Grandma, err, Ella the head witch suspects that it was your dormant magic power." You shuddered at the thought. "Still, it was something never before attempted so I'm not sure."

"Okay...." Shaken, Joe said. "So, what now then?"

You sighed. "I guess we wait."
155312221.title: You tell Joe about magic.

1553122212.content:
In another part of the house, a set of stairs leading into the basement opened and dad walked up another set from a glowing door to face mom with a scorned look only a protective mother could make. Dad sighed, seeing her. "We shall talk in the library." Softly, he said. "There is no sense in involving the children any further."

Mom nodded and the two vanished as the stairs fell back into place. They reappeared inside a large library filled with books on both magic and mad science where they each took a seat and dad summoned a tea set. "How dare you just give our son a lab to toy with unsupervised!" In a forced calm, mom said. "You placed him in mortal danger in your obsessive quest to experiment!"

"Not quite, my emotional beloved." Calmly, dad countered. "Had I done exactly that, your mother would have been far more furious than you." He poured a cup of tea. "You see, there was a growing fear among the witch council that, due to chaotic science, a pseudo or fake witch would one day be born."

Mom turned pale at that. "Is that why you used our son?!" Startled, she asked. "To prove this theory false?"

Dad shook his head. "No, to prove it accurate." Darkly, he said. "You see, our son is a witch boy despite his lineage to me. That said, using his dormant magical power, he was able to work magic with the use of obsolete gadgetry."

"And what did you find." Shaking, mom demanded.

Dad sighed, handing mom the cup of tea. "Had I given him a full laboratory instead of a 'mini lab', he would have bridged the gap, making magic work through science." He then poured himself a cup of tea, shaking himself. "It is not only possible for the witching world to one day see its first pseudo witch, it is inevitable."

"What has our son become then?" Her anger returning, mom demanded.

"Joe remains as he was as I had placed powerful safeguards to ensure his safety." Bemused, dad said. "He is only furious and distraught because he fears he created a rift in the family and that you took away that which I had given him."

"You should have consulted me first." Shaking her head, mom fumed.

"The chances of you agreeing were zero." Calmly, dad replied. "So I went above you to the head witch. She reluctantly agreed." He sighed then added, "However, I alone was to deal with your wrath once you found out."

Mom was beyond words. "If I find but a scratch on my son other than from his fall..."

She then vanished from the library, allowing her words to hang as Elle Mist appeared inside the room. "I must agree with your wife." Calmly, she said. "this should have been a family decision."

"Then why did you allow me to proceed?" Raising an eyebrow, dad countered.

Elle sighed. "The need to know."

Mom reappeared outside of Joe's room and entered, starting you, Joe, and the twins. She ignored your protest and waved a hand over Joe. "Reveal what is hidden." Casting a spell, he said.

Joe shrieked as his clothes vanished in front of you and the twins! Ina and Tia both turned around, blushing brightly though they could not help snicker. You were horrified and Joe was mortified. Mom however, sighed as she saw...
1553122212.title: Mom is protective too.

15531222121.content:
Joe was not harmed in the least though blushing madly with embarrassment and badly trembling in anger. "Why....?!" Through gritted teeth, he hissed.

Mom waved her hand, replacing Joe's clothing with fresh items, blushing herself but she was ready with an excuse. "Good.... no signs of you becoming a pseudo witch." Softly, she said. "Still, your father took a gamble with your life."

"What do you mean?" Sitting up, Joe demanded. "There was a reason you made me naked in front of my sisters?!"

Mom sighed before waving her hand at Ina and Tia. The two crumpled to the floor, unconscious. "They will only remember this as a dream." Calmly, mom said.

"What were you looking for, mom?" Wincing, you demanded.

"Scars and had your brother been covered in them, there would have been divorce papers flying." Serious, mom replied. "He used Joe to prove that its is not only possible but inevitable for a pseudo witch to be born due to chaotic science."

"Would the same apply for chaotic science?" Worried, you asked.

Mom nodded. "If a boy can make magic work through science, it is equally possible for a girl to make chaotic science work through magic."

"I guess my chances of getting that lab back is a zero." Pouting, Joe said.

"I think I can find you something to occupy your time." Smiling, mom said. "I kind of owe you for the little humiliation."

"What are you offering?" Uncertain, Joe asked.

Mom smiled and offered you....
15531222121.title: Joe fine but humiliated.

choices: Ask mom for a real magic book.
155312221212.content:
Curious, you looked at the book mom offered Joe and smiled slightly. Your brother read the title. "The Magic book for the curious boy... is this a joke?"

"It's not a joke, Joe." Smiling, you said. "This book allows a witch born boy to explore magic without the witch mother or sister forcing magic upon him."

"What's the catch?" Suspicious, Joe asked.

"The book works with your dormant magic power." Smiling, mom said. "It is up to you how to use or not use the book. No one will force you."

Joe raised a single eyebrow. He was curious but still skeptical. "Thanks... I think." Softly, he said. "I'll take a look at it."

"Do you want me to be with you, just in case?" Kindly, you asked.

Joe nodded. "Please."

Joe took the book to his desk, opened the cover and began to read...

'Greetings, curious boy. In this book, you will learn many secrets and the reasons behind them. Be fair warned that once you begin reading this book, your life will forever change. If you are still curious, turn the page; if not close the book and return it to whom had given it to you.'

Joe scoffed. "A little late for that." Sarcastically, he muttered.

Both you and mom winced at that but watched as Joe turned the page to read on, darkly curious....

'All of the girls in your family are witches, possessing the power of magic. Only girls have the power to use magic as it is focused in the uterus, an organ only girls possess. Boys born in witch families possess incredible physical attributes due to the dormant magical power within them; this is the balance that exists in witch families.'

Joe sighed. "Only my dad is a mad scientist so I have the strength of a witch boy and the boy magic of a chaotic scientist." Shaking his head, he continued to read...

'Many boys in witch families require proof, the three following mixtures will give that proof, they work with a boy's dormant magical power. The first potion will surprise you. The second will educate you. The third is only to be made if you wish to continue reading and learning magic...'

This peaked Joe's curiosity and he looked at the ingredients to all three potions. "I can find all of these in the kitchen and the garden." whispering, Joe said. "I don't need proof that magic or mad science is real but still, I wonder could I really work this magic as a boy...?"

Both you and mom smiled at that as you watched and waited for Joe to make a decision regarding the book. Finally, he decided to...
155312221212.title: a strange book.

choices: Yes, I want a magic book.
1553122212124.content:
To your surprise and mom's somewhat disappointment, Joe closed the book and handed it back to her. Only she and you smiled when he said in all seriousness, "Give me a real magic book."

"Are you certain?" A smile forming, mom asked. "You know you can't even read the magic book unless you are a girl."

"That remains to be seen." Calmly, Joe said. "The book you gave me is designed to satisfy a witch boy's curiosity." He sighed adding, "I can assure you that my curiosity is satisfied, just not fully."

Mom's smile grew as she caused the first book to vanish and a second book to appear. "This is a magic book for beginners." Grinning, she said. "If you open it and the magic detects a boy, you will be reduced to a seven year old girl."

"No games, mom." Serious, Joe said. "Not if you want to keep wetting my appetite to learn more."

"Magic is not your root power." Shrugging, mom said. "Therefore, you have start at the beginning to be safe." She giggled. "I really didn't have to warn you about the subtle safeguards of the magic book as you asked for it directly."

You smiled at mom's mischief only you were a little worried that she might be having a little too much fun. "Learning magic at a younger age reduces the chances of your female form becoming locked." Softly, you said. "It's a sensible precaution."

Mom sighed. "I was getting to that, dear." patiently, she said. She then smiled at Joe. "Do you still want a magic book?"

Joe sighed then replied...
1553122212124.title: Ask mom for a real magic book.

15531222121241.content:
Mom smiled, giving Joe the magic book. He placed it onto his desk only he did not open it, he merely rubbed the cover as if it were made of glass. "Strange..." Softly, he said. "This book is not giving me the same feeling I got from the old gadgets."

"Magic and chaotic science are polar opposites of each other." Serious, you said. "What dad gave you was the ability to work magic through science to prove it can be done."

"So opening this book would really change me into a little girl." Gulping, Joe said. He sighed, turning to mom. "Would you be able to change me back?"

"I could change you back with little effort but I would rather use the opportunity to give you some magic resistance training." Serious, mom replied.

"You mean make me learn how to resist the magic enough to change myself back?" Guessing correctly, Joe asked. Mom nodded and he sighed. "I guess that makes sense, we are not the only witch and mad science family around."

"Are you going to open the book?" Curious, mom asked.

After a pause, Joe gave a shy smile. "Only if you promise to walk me through the lessons and let me change back once I learn how."

Mom smiled with a hint of pride. "I would be honored." Softly, she said.

You could only shake your head knowing that by the time Joe learns how to change herself back, she may not want to.

Joe moved to open the book only paused as...
15531222121241.title: Joe wants to learn some magic.

info.brief_description: A sequel to The Mad Scientist
info.description:
A brief history of this story: 200 hundred years ago, a rip in time and space was opened by a band of rogue or criminal witches hoping to unlock a mythological world of pure magic. What they did instead was to strand hundreds of boys and girls from a parallel world. At the same time, stranding hundreds of witch girls and boys in the world these strangers came from. The stranded boys called themselves mad scientists and had a power equal to magic, tipping the balance of power as before, only witch born girls had such supernatural power. In present day, these mad scientists are striving to grow in power; attempting to recruiting all boys born from a mad scientist father.

You play a fourteen year old witch named Gina Mage who recently graduated at the top of her class at Cauldron Academy all girls boarding school where she learned witchcraft.

You have a fair relationship with your mother, Mona Mage (35) who is an expert in combat magic and offers tutoring services to young witches with mad scientist brothers and or fathers.

You have a good relationship with your younger brother, Joe Mage (13) who is a very strong and talented athlete with high hopes to enter the Olympics someday.

You have a decent relationship with your twin youngest sisters, Tia and Ina Mage (7) who have magic at a young age and seem to specialize in teleportation which they use to lightheartedly play jokes on Joe.

You have a neutral relationship with your father, Geo Mage (35) who is a mad scientist. He is rarely around and more rarely seen by you. He believes his long absences will ease the tensions with your mom and the witch community. He sees it as protecting the family, you see it in another way.

Your mom would rather see your brother, Joe become a girl and a witch as the power is within him. However, many mad scientists would wish of recruit your brother, claiming that it is his birthright, his destiny to follow in his father's footsteps. Can you protect your brother Joe from being pulled into the world of mad science or will you allow him to embrace the power he has as a boy? The choice is yours.

You have two neighbors whom you had been friends with since childhood. Rachel Scott (13) who has a crush on Joe and you suspect he has a crush on her. Neither yet has the courage to confess their feelings. Thomas Lore (14) Who you know has a huge crush on you but you are not sure if you feel the same way.

New Characters: Aunt Abra Mage. (30yrs and a widow) You have a pleasant relationship with her and her children, Henry (13yrs) and Rita (12yrs). Abra Mage has black hair and green eyes. Henry has blond hair and blue eyes. Rita has black hair and blue eyes.

The rules:

1. No killing off characters.

2. Magic or Mad Science can not kill or resurrect.

3. Only human/humanoid transformations.

4. You may add new characters.
